1.content: You could be a powerful person throughout any type of fiction! Video games, movies, TV shows, books and more! What genre should we begin? Remember you must serve an existing evil woman!
1.title: Choose Your World

11.content:
Buffy the Vampire Slayer - Buffy and her band of friends fight evil some of which are evil female witches, vampires and hell Gods... which evil force will you serve?

Lost - A TV show about a plan crashing on a deserted island. All is not what is seems and several of the castaways are royal bitches. And of course more people are on the island!

Star Trek - Who knows what evil female aliens are there?
11.title: TV Shows

111.content:
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Buffy_the_V...

Glory - Evil Hell Goddess. She's spoiled petulant and very powerful.

Evil Faith - Before Faith turns good... With your help she will reign as the evil queen B.

Drusilla - Psycho female vampire. Serving her will be... interesting.
111.title: Buffy the Vampire Slayer

1112.content:
Who is Faith?

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Faith_%28Bu...

Pictures of her:
http://www.zimbio.com/Eliza+Dushku/artic...

But who are you in this story?

Watcher - Part of a secret organization designed to help train, assist and advise the slayer.

Magic User - A warlock? A wizard? Some other powerful user of the arcane arts?

Readers Choice
1112.title: Evil Faith

choices: Find her at a club and try to hook up
11122.content:
You are a warlock, essentially a powerful male witch. You've used your magic to enhance your own body with superior strength, speed and toughness. In addition to that you also still have an array of magical abilities. You know spells that have long been lost and the combination of lethal magic and dangerous fighting skills makes you arguably the most competent fighter on the planet.

You could do an incredible amount of good with your powers but you had stayed on the sidelines studying more and more mystical lore. Something strange perked your interest however. Two slayers in the existence of the world. The concept of having two supernaturally strong women fighting against vampires intrigued you. What if more than 2 could exist simultaneously. You bent your mind to research and then the 2nd slayer died. You were deeply curious to learn if the slayer would pass along again - and it did. To a young beautiful woman by the name of Faith.

You did a little bit more research and used your magic to scry on her. When you did so you felt your knees tremble. This woman was a picture of perfection. Her looks, her attitude her very nature made you yearn to fall to your knees in worshipful supplication. But how to approach her? From your observations from afar she was an angry young woman. She had defied the Watchers and had harmed the other slayer's friends. Do this wrong and she might despise you forever...
11122.title: Magic User

choices: Faith is thankful for your help...phew!
Faith is pissed off that you interfered...uh oh!
111222.content:
Walking though one of the many Sunnydale cemeteries, consumed in your thoughts about the powerful, beautiful Faith, you almost let out a yelp of surprise when in the distance you saw a dark haired woman locked in combat with a couple of vampires. Surely it couldn't be...?!

Edging closer towards the ruckus, using a tombstone to obscure yourself behind, you felt your heart racing uncontrollably as you got a proper view. It was her! Her unmistakeably lithe, athletic figure, along with her combative grunts...it was definitely the slayer alright! Well, one of them - the one you had lusted after!

"Man, you vamps really got a death wish, huh?" The gorgeous brunette stated, while performing an impressive spin kick on one of the her opponents.

The other glared at her, "Slayer! We're gonna grind you into paste, pull out a ribcage and-"

"Wear it like a hat? Yeah, yeah - heard 'em all before!" Faith laughed disdainfully as she planted a crisp kick to the vamp's chest, then followed it with an impressive-looking uppercut.

"You really are frickin' stupid! The pair of you! You know I work for Wilkins, right?" The slayer explained, pulling out a stake, toying with it as she passed it from hand to hand.

"Wilkins...who the hell?" Muttered one of the vamps, gingerly nursing the point where he had been hit, but his eyes fixed warily on his foe.

You had to contain a frustrated sigh of your own. Did these vamps know nothing about Mayor Richard Wilkins (the third)? Since you had been around Sunnydale for a few weeks or so now, it was obvious - to those in the supernatural know at least - that he was the big cheese, the man with the power!

Faith's disdain clearly echoed your thoughts. "Don't even know Wilkins..." She chuckled as she casually dusted the vamp who had just spoke. A groaning, crumbling sound reverberated around you as you watched the vampire perish. You had done a fair few yourself, but boy was that impressive!

The other vampire seemed to think so too. "Look, we're like, obviously on the same side here. I thought "slayer" - goody-goody, wants to kill me..."

"Hey, that little miss Buffy is NOTHIN' like me - ya hear?" Faith shouted out angrily.

"Ok, I'm sorry, I mean," the vampire said, sounding more than flustered. "Just let me go and we're...all good here!"

"Oh really? Well that sounds five by five to me..." Faith smiled before snapping an axe kick forcefully down onto her foe's unsuspecting head. He let out a groan as he crumpled to the dirty ground. In the blink of an eye, she used her leather boot to pin his squirming body firmly to the ground.

"So you wanna live, huh?" Faith chuckled nastily at her beaten opponent.

"Yes...yes!" Cried out the vamp, clearly desperate to live, such was his lack of fight.

"You can live...if you kiss my boot." Faith winked and grinned as she lowered her other boot so it was positioned just over his face. You couldn't see the sole of the boot from where you were, but you imagined clumps of earth and tufts of grass adorning it.

"What...?" The vampire groaned. However, his voice was meek, indicating that he probably had little pride left. This proved true as he pushed his mouth against her boot, choking a little on what was presumably dirt that had fallen down his throat.

"Gee...thanks!" Faith giggled. Just as the vampire let out a sigh of relief, with lightning speed, she suddenly drew a stake and dusted him rapidly.

Your mouth hung open as you witnessed this dominance. From the vamp kissing her boot to staking him...you could not help but feel completely besotted with this goddess!

"Later suckers!" Faith chuckled to herself as she picked up her stake and began stalking away.

"Look out!" You cried as another vampire dashed at her from behind. Racing over, you quickly muttered the incantation for a pyro-creating spell to completely inflame the vamp. Staggering around, he screamed in agony but was dust in just a few seconds. Faith watched open-eyed at first the pile of dust that could have killed her, then at you, standing right in front of her.

"Hi," you said, a touch awkwardly, being rather starstruck.

"Hey," she replied, her expression unreadable...
111222.title: You meet Faith!

choices: She gives you a call soon.
She doesn't call so you seek her out again.
1112221.content:
"That was a cool move you did to roast that vamp. What's your name, who are you?"

You provide an introduction and explain you are a warlock who happened to be in the area.

"Well thanks for helping me dust 'em. You're not too bad for one of those magic users."

Phew she is thankful for my help.

"Anytime Faith." You give her a card with your name and number.

"You were absolutely breathtaking in the way you fought. I had heard the legends of the Slayers and now I see that they are all true. No doubt you would have been able to handle the creature but I saw no reason to take chances."

Faith took the card from your hand and gave you a smile.

"I may take you up on that offer at some point but for now I got to run. Later."

And with that she was gone.
1112221.title: Faith is thankful for your help...phew!

choices: Keep fighting her but be cautious!
Kneel down and declare your love for her!
1112222.content:
Trepidation began to melt down your spine when Faith narrowed her eyes and raise her stake threateningly towards you.

"What the hell are you? And why you, like, gettin' in my way?" She said challengingly.

You felt a mixture of arousal and frustration. Having potentially just saved this girl's life, her menacing tone and raised stake seemed rather unnecessary! Still, any act of aggression or combativeness from her made you undeniably in awe of this beauty!

"I'm a warlock. I didn't mean to get in your way - I was only trying to help," you stated reasonably.

"A warlock, huh? You into all that magic and shit? One of B's little geek pals is into that stuff. Total loser!" Faith snickered, though you were sure you detected a slightly resentful look in her eyes.

"Look, Faith-"

"What did you just call me?" Her tone was soft but dangerous as she interrupted you.

"Oh, I mean...you see, I, er..." You babbled as she shook her head at you in disbelief.

"You, like, stalkin' me? Hey - I know everyone's gonna get their kicks an' all. But, that's kinda weird, warlock." She emphasised this last word with a sneer.

Before you could even reply, Faith suddenly launched a barrage of punches and kicks at you. Being a supremely proficient fighter, you were able to block and parry each blow with relative ease, though you had to admit that your reflexes had never quite been tested like this before!

"Listen," you said firmly, grabbing both of her hands and twisting them behind her back so they were locked together. "I'm not here to fight you!"

"Well, goody for you. But, I am..." Faith panted as she somehow performed a back flip, wrenching free from you, then extended one leg fully to kick you sharply in the ribs. "What can I say? I just love a good fight! You got some mad skills. Show me some more!" Faith grinned at you.

Part of you wanted to continue this fight; it was certainly erotic exchanging blows and making physical contact with this powerful slayer. But was it time to make your intentions clear and kneel before her? There was also a chance that your instincts could take over and cause you to lose your temper...the idea of hurting or damaging this goddess was a no no!
1112222.title: Faith is pissed off!

choices: You step it up a notch and use some powerful magic.
You continue to brawl with her hopefully you can create separation.
11122221.content:
She was clearly looking for a fight - taking away her fun might not cast you in a positive light. Nonetheless you would be cautious.

"Be careful what you wish for Faith."

Faith grins and launches another swift kick at you. This time you were ready and instead of blocking you put a bit of magic into the palm of your hand and released compressed air toward the charging Slayer. The air hit her and launched her back 10 feet. Faith landed beautifully and rolled back up to her feet and dashed toward you with surprising speed.

You charge another blast of air that she slides under it unexpectedly. Rising up to her knees her fist races up toward your unprotected manhood and you hastily twist your leg into the path and take the punch on the thigh. It stings but it isn't disastrous. You counter with a hip check that knocks the slayer onto her back. She flip kicks back to her feet into a fighting stance and you circle her warily.

"So how long have you been stalkin' me?"

The question catches you off guard and the wily girl uses the time you were taking to come up with a response to hurl a stake at you. You deflect it out of the air and she launches a swift jump kick toward you. You spin to the side with just enough time, her boot was a centimeter from connecting with you. Backing away from her you bring more magic into play and roots erupt from the ground attempting to grapple the girl.

She dodges one but another manages to snag her foot.

"Get the fuck off of me!" She yells and uses her free boot to break the root. She snarls at you and races toward you. With your ability to use magic she needed to get in close quickly. She was no novice to battle and clearly saw that her only chance was to get into hand to hand combat with you.

You decide to meet her charge hoping to surprise her. You lash out with your magic attempting to shove her legs out from under her but with startling agility she sees your hand and twists in mid air avoiding the compressed air. She lands right next to you and a sharp elbow comes straight for your face. You block the elbow but her superior strength causes you to stumble back awkwardly. She presses her advantage with a vicious punch to your chest. Off balance you still mange to block her attack successfully.

What follows is a rapid close quarters martial arts duel. You can't get the breathing room needed to channel your magic and she isn't letting up. Her stamina was amazing and despite the excellent shape you were in clearly superior to yours.

You had some spells that could put the hurt on her but you would never want to inflict such damage on the object of your affection. On the other hand if this kept you might actually lose. And Faith may do you in like she did the vamp. Suddenly and without mercy!
11122221.title: Keep fighting her but be cautious!

choices: Teleport away to recuperate and recover!
Faith is a goddess - do nothing and let her do as she pleases!
111222212.content:
Truth be told, the sparring and jostling with Faith was so enjoyable that you simply had to continue it!

However, you still had to be cautious of the lethal blows that she relentlessly rained down upon you! As you sidestepped a flying fist, pain exploded through you; realisation dawned after a second or two of sheer agony - Faith had kicked you with ferocious fury in the privates!

"Ha!" She grunted, before unleashing a triumphant uppercut, forcing you to your knees.

Quickly muttering a cooling spell to quell the pain in your groin region, the dark-haired slayer swiftly smashed a boot directly into your mouth, splitting your lips and forcing a yelp of pain from you.

"Knew I'd beat you, witch-boy. Always do in the end!" She smirked as she slapped your face so hard, following it up immediately with a backfist to your nose - so hard that you nearly felt it break.

Kneeling before this gorgeous woman, pain ricocheting through most of your body, any fight seemed to evaporate away, especially after she kicked you viciously twice in the ribs, you were sure at least one broke! Had this been any other foe, you would have deployed a clever tactic or spell to turn the tables. Not this time though!

"Please, Faith!" You mumbled weakly up to her. "Please, no more!"

"Man, you really ain't as tough as you thought, huh?" Faith snickered as she raised a boot to your face, hovering it there. Your arms limply hanging at your sides, your will to fight back completely gone, you cringed but secretly felt more aroused than ever. Images of the vampire Faith had forced to kiss her boot just a few minutes ago entered your head.

"Kiss it," she ordered with authority, confirming your dark prediction of a fantasy.

Excitement pulsed through your veins; now she was exerting your dominance on you, you felt like a piece of putty in her hands. You could even feel a bit of wood forming in your pants, despite the throbbing pain still there!

You puckered your lips to kiss at the sole of her boot, tasting dirt and other unpleasant aromas from the ground. Humiliation built inside you, especially with her scornful laughter, but you could not deny this dangerous beauty!

"Ok, loser," She laughed nastily before retracting her dirty boot from your mouth. "Now, how best to put you out of your misery..."

Staring up into her dark, wild eyes, you considered your options. Did you have the wherewithal to plead for mercy or muster the strength to teleport away - before she could kill you?
111222212.title: You continue to brawl with her hopefully you ca...

choices: She wants you to go undercover to infiltrate Buffy and the Gang!
She wants to absorb all of your magical skill and power!
1112222121.content:
In a blink of an eye, Faith pulled a stake out and swung it back, a look of triumph adorning her attractive face.

"No, please Faith - I beg you! Please don't stake me!" You bowed down at her feet, desperately hoping that this brown-haired beauty would show you some mercy.

"Er, why should I? In case you hadn't noticed, I kinda do what I want!" She said arrogantly, using a leather boot to push down against the back of your head, forcing your face into the ground.

"Pppfffleasffree!" You shouted, your voice completely muffled by the dirt and mud that you were tasting.

"I guess you're not a vamp...and you were wicked strong. Til I kicked your ass! Maybe you could be...I dunno....like, some use to me..." She said thoughtfully, relinquishing the pressure of her boot enough on your head so that you were able to lift your face away from the ground a little.

She stepped back, observing you shrewdly all the while. Her stake still held menacingly in front of her, her eyes narrowed at you, she allowed you to shift back to your knees.

"Please, Faith. Please - I have watched you and am completely besotted by you. You're so strong, so sexy...please just allow me to worship and serve you!" You gushed at her, the process almost cathartic.

"Watched me huh? Like Giles and Wes? I never knew you watchers had crazy magic powers!" She remarked.

"No, I'm not a watcher," you breathed heavily at her. You knew about watchers: they guided and educated the slayer, well slayers - plural - in this case. They did not have preternatural strength or were imbued with magical powers like you. You had watched Faith long enough to know that she had abandoned the Watcher's Council, had allied herself with Mayor Wilkins, and was a sworn enemy to the "good" slayer - Buffy Summers.

"So you're a...warlock but ain't workin' for no one? You're not, like, a demon?" She asked, a look of slight repulsion on her face as she wrinkled her nose.

"Yes...I mean, I'm not a demon, I'm a human with magical strength and powers. And I work for no one but you, my goddess," you stated.

"Wow...you really got it bad, huh? Wish that sap Angel had showed me the respect you did! Yeah you're right," she quickly moved on..."I AM a goddess!"

"Please, just let me serve you - I'll do anything you want me to! Anything!" You gazed up at her hopefully, yearning desperately for her just to let you worship her.

"Hmm...like I said, you got some mad skills, boy. I guess I could put you to some use..." She grinned at you, her eyes flashing excitedly...
1112222121.title: Beg and plead for mercy!

choices: Watch her fight and help her - she'll hopefully be more appreciative than Faiith
Pretend to be someone else in order to befriend her...
Just spy on her for now
11122221211.content:
"You really wanna serve me, right?" Faith continued to speak, a confident expression on her face.

"Yes...please goddess...please let me!" You gasped, your entire body almost convulsing with pleasure at the thought of finally getting to worship this ridiculously sexy woman.

"Okay, okay...chill," she said softly, reassuringly. "You'll get to, like, be a slave to me, if you do something for me...."

"Of course...just tell me what to do!" You beamed excitedly at her.

"Listen up, warlock. You're gonna keep an eye on little miss Buffy pants - you know, the other slayer. The one who's like 'Ooh I'm so good and righteous!'. Anyway, you're gonna use every bit of your, like, skill, to find a way to get all pally with her. You'll report back to me, then when the time's right, you'll kill her!" Her eyes were wild, dangerous, and oh so alluring! "You got all that, warlock?"

Killing Buffy? You hadn't met the other slayer, but from what you had heard, she was a decent, noble person and warrior. You were by no means evil or soulless, but you were so enchanted by Faith, that the idea of murdering an innocent woman - the sworn enemy of your goddess - did not in truth seem too daunting. Faith's bad-ass nature seemed to have instilled some ruthlessness in you.

"I'll do it," you muttered quickly. "Where will I meet you to report back to you?"

Faith's nose crinkled as an expression of delight spread over her tough but beautiful features. "Good boy! Meet me here this time tomorrow. I wanna know everything about what Miss B and her geek pals are up to. Everything, y'hear?" She raised her eyebrows expectantly at you.

"Yes, yes of course!" You slowly rose to your feet, after Faith lowered her stake, her arms folded. "I'll think of something!"

"You better, warlock! Coulda killed you tonight, y'know? You gotta chance to prove you're, like, worthy. Anyways, laters." She brushed casually past you; you turned around to watch her sexy, athletic frame rapidly becoming a small dot in the distance.

A few moments after leaving you, realisation began to sink in. You were working for Faith! Finally, a chance to become her devoted slave!

So, forcing your mind to focus on your new mission, you decided on the best way to approach it. How best to orchestrate a situation where you are in a position to make Buffy trust you?
11122221211.title: An undercover mission?

choices: Yup she bought it hook line and sinker!
She doubts you - time to see how well you fight against this Slayer!
111222212111.content:
You loved your dark Goddess Faith but you had to admit that she had a tough shell around her. Buffy Summers on the other hand was a snarky kind-hearted warrior of the light.

You decided to try the same thing you did with Faith. You would follow Buffy until she encountered some vampires and the you would spring out and help her deal with the trash. This time you should be able to give a good impression and then you'll be in. You cast a spell that made you blend in with your surroundings and a second one to quiet any slight noises you made while you stalked the young Slayer.

You didn't have to wait long. This close to the Hell Mouth meant that vampires were drawn to it like moths to a flame. Sure enough you saw a trio of vampires rush toward the blonde slayer. Buffy instantly turned and staked one like it was nothing. You quickly sprang into action - you had to be quick or she would take them all out!

You fire a blast of compressed air at one of the vampire's legs and he stumbles down hard. In an instant you are there and are driving a stake into his back quickly dusting him. You turn and see Buffy duel the other vampire who quickly goes down a stomp to his foot followed by a one two punch combination that ends with Buffy staking the vampire.

She looks up at you warily.

"Who are you?"

You incline your head slightly. "I'm a friend. There is a prophecy that you must listen to."

"A prophecy? Does that make you a prophet? Because you look a bit too modern to be some crazy bearded guy in furs like they normally are."

You smile wryly you liked the girl. It wouldn't save her but you would feel regret when Faith had you murder her.

"Shall I then speak to thee like thus? Ye will fine it tiresome."

"Oh god no, go back, go back!"

"Of course. Listen well Slayer." You were lying through your teeth of course. There was no prophecy this was all just a ploy to get in close with her.

"Two of what should be one will emerge to fight the immortal. Strength is not enough. Magic will show the way for two to be one again. If the Slayer heeds not the words the pit that never closes will vomit forth the dead un-ending."

Buffy looked at you. "Huh?"

You shrug, "Prophecies are vague but I believe I know some of it. You must heed my words and I will bring the magic that will show the way. The pit that never closes is probably the Hell Mouth. That's all I know." You shrug, "Prophecies sure can be annoying huh?"

You think you had the Slayer fooled but did you?
111222212111.title: Watch her fight and help her - she'll hopef...

choices: Decide to take on Angel's form - go find him now!
Take on the form of an unfamiliar teacher or student instead!
111222212112.content:
After getting some more information about Buffy from Willie the Snitch (man, that demon bar sucked!), you decided on the best way of imposing someone that would enable you to befriend her...

Several options came to mind:

The vampire Angel - unique in the fact that he had a soul - was someone who she obviously confided in, despite the on-off relationship he had shared with Buffy. If you could find him, there was a complex spell that would enable you to take on his form...that could work!

Then again, she may suspect something is up if you fail to mimic his mannerisms, or respond to her in an out-of-character way... Would it be better to pretend to be someone unfamiliar - a teacher or pupil at her school who apparently had little to no contact with her possibly?

You consider each option carefully before making a decision...
111222212112.title: Pretend to be someone else in order to befriend...

choices: It all goes to plan! You have adopted Angel's form!
1112222121121.content:
Deciding that adopting Angel's form would present you with the best opportunity to get information from and, eventually, to betray Buffy, you headed towards his crypt. Good old Willie the Snitch - he seemed to know all the demon hideouts!

Minutes later, you stealthily crept into the dark, gloomy but modestly renovated place where Angel dwelt. You felt confident; although you had allowed Faith to get the better of you, a mere vampire would offer little fight surely!

"Who the hell are you?" Came a deep voice from behind you.

Turning round, you stared at the tall, dark and admittedly handsome man. With his carefully gelled hair and deep set eyes, this was him alright: Angel - the vampire with a soul!

"Angel. The vampire who lost his fangs," you replied smirking at him.

"I know who I am. And by the way, I can still bite..." Angel used his super strength to grasp you by your coat, attempting to throw you against the wall. "I said: who the hell are you?" He repeated, his handsome face morphing into that of an evil, hideous-looking creature.

"I told you - I'm you, well I will be soon..." You said ominously before ducking down and sweeping Angel's legs so he tumbled to the floor.

It felt refreshing to battle with an opponent without fear of hurting them, or pissing them off. As Angel struggled to his feet, you unleashed a brutal array of punches, expertly directed at his mid section.

Snarling, the vampire backed quickly away to recover. "Look, I don't know what your problem is, but this isn't a fight you wanna be in, boy..."

Calling you 'boy' was a mistake on his part; lunging forward you planted a swift kick to his thigh, followed by a sharp jab to his forehead, knocking him back to the ground. To your surprise, he managed to roll out of the way of your descending knee, quickly punching you in the chin and ribs in quick succession. Still, it didn't deter you for long; parrying another one of his blows, you kneed him hard in the gut, forcing him to stagger back.

"Faith says hi, by the way." You grin at him before smashing him sharply in the face, rendering him unconsious. You felt a surge of pride at mentioning your beloved's name.

Not wasting any time, you dragged Angel's body into position, closed the entrance, then began setting about your work. The form-adoption spell was a complex one. Quickly laying out all the ingredients and potions, you muttered all of the incantations and began to feel yourself shudder a little. It was working!

You continued....were you able to complete the spell successfully or did something go wrong?
1112222121121.title: Warlock vs Angel!

11122221211211.content:
A few more minutes passed; with every utterance of the complex spell, you felt electrical sensations surge through your body. Suddenly, flashing golden and orange colours collided and circled around you. With a gasp, you felt your body collapse on to the ground. All went dark...

Some time later - it was hard to tell how long exactly - you awoke on the hard ground, feeling strangely different. Glancing around, the first thing you noticed was your own body lying opposite you. What the...?! Of course! You had swapped bodies with Angel! Rising to your feet you quickly began looking for a mirror. Not being able to find one, you used your phone to hold the camera lens in front of you. When you saw nothing other than Angel's crypt on the screen, you first thought you had turned invisible! Then it hit you - vampires don't have a reflection!

Using your hands to feel your clothes, carefully gelled hair and face, you reasoned that the change had been successful. Concentrating hard on showing your "vamp face" enabled you to run a finger gingerly along your fangs and feel the bumpy forehead and other facial distortions, which came with vampire transformation. It had worked!

Carefully moving your actual body (which must now inhabit an unconscious Angel), you performed a series of simple spells - charms, and protections to wrap the body tightly in chains, seal it over firmly over with various layers, then stow it away safely.

Satisfied with your work, you ventured out of the crypt and towards Buffy's house. As you got there, it was clear that no one was in - no lights on, not even a car there. Deciding instead to head to the school library - apparently the regular meeting place, event at night for this slayer and her gang - you muttered a quick spell to give you the ability to fly...no time to waste after all!

Reaching Sunnydale High School, you lowered yourself down and walked through the entranc, heading towards the library. As you opened the door, you were met with the sight of...
11122221211211.title: A successful spell!

choices: Buffy smells a rat! She starts questioning you!
You make out with her instead - best way to appear less suspicious!
111222212112111.content:
There she was, Buffy Summers: Faith's arch-nemesis and rival! The young woman was beautiful; she had long, blonde hair, tanned skin and a powerful aura about her.

"Hey," you said walking in the room and smiling at her.

"Angel?" She moved from the desk where she had been sitting and rushed over to you, wrapping her arms round your neck in a strong embrace. "Well this is a nice surprise!"

"Yeah..I thought I'd check on you..." You reply, a touch nervous about impersonating someone you barely knew.

"And I appreciate it." She grinned at you, before pulling your mouth to meet hers in a passionate kiss. You had to admit, despite being sworn enemy to your goddess Faith, this slayer was hot! But not in the commanding, dominant way of the other slayer.

"You alone?" you enquired, trying to be cool and laconic: Angel's trademark manners, according to Willie the Snitch. You had approximately a week before this spell would wear off, such was the capability of your magic. That should be easily enough time to pass on information to Faith, before striking at the right time to kill this seemingly innocent woman...

"Yeah..." She sighed. Giles has had enough of Wes and has headed home, that doofus is out with Cordy somewhere. Willow and Oz are at her place...not sure about Xander. So yeah, we're alone," she smiled before pulling you in for another kiss.

Maybe this undercover mission had a few perks after all! You allowed Buffy's gentle, yet firm tongue push and swirl around your mouth; you felt her heart beat increase as she snuggled into your chest.

She pulled her head back and gave you a slight frown. "But I'm guessing you're here for business..." She rolled her eyes a little.

"Um, yeah." You decided it best to get straight to your mission. Plus it felt weird kissing this slayer, almost as though you were betraying Faith!

"Have you found out anything else about the Mayor?" You asked, thinking quickly and logically.

"What apart from the fact that he can't be harmed or killed, has Faith as his right hand muscle, is going to ascend or whatever and is, like, evil?" She raised her eyebrows as she smiled playfully at you. Man was she cute!

"So nothing new?"

"No," she sighed. "I mean, it was only the other day that Wilkins got his hands on the box of Gavron...Gabrok...uh, whatever. It's like, the ascension can't be too far away, Prom is only around the corner..."

You forgot how young and immature she was at heart. Not much more than a kid, yet so much more! Like Faith, being a slayer seemed to have embedded an intangible sexiness and grace about her. It was helped that like Faith she was smoking hot!

"So no news then?" You asked.

She frowned at you, this time more seriously. 'Yeah. I told you that. What's with you tonight?"

Maybe you had been too pushy with your information-seeking. Hopefully this wouldn't compromise your mission at all...
111222212112111.title: Buffy - all alone!

choices: Punch the kid and warn him not to piss you off!
Ignore him and leave - on to the demon hideout!
1112222121121112.content:
You had to step this up a notch. Pulling the slayer firmly and tightly towards you, you started to make out with her, passionately!

"Buffy...how I want you so much..." You moaned, not having to act particularly as you were enjoying yourself immensely. "I just...want to help...in any way I can..." You gasped between kisses.

The cute blonde returned your kisses with relish, using both hands to slide up and down your chest, squeezing your body as she sighed with pleasure.

"No...no...we can't," she breathed heavily at you. "You know what will happen..." Her face was full of frustrated concern as she gazed up at you.

"Yeah I know. And sorry to keep going on about Wilkins. I just can't bear to see you worried like that," you say gently, squeezing her warm body. And you knew exactly what she meant: Willie had told you all about the curse: how one moment of happiness would cause Angel to lose his soul. Again!

"Thank you," she said simply, smiling as you pushed a golden lock of hair out of her eyes.

"I better go - in case...anything else happens," you tell her with a sigh. She accepted this and kissed you goodbye before returning to her research. Deciding it best to find out a bit more about Wilkins before your meeting with Faith tomorrow evening, you headed out of the school and started to make your way towards another demon hideout you knew.

"Oh, it's you. So not making out with Faith or punching me in the face for a change, huh?"

You turned round to see a dark-haired teenager, wearing baggy clothes and unfriendly look about him. He looked about eighteen - a similar age to Buffy. Damn...who was this kid - was he a friend of Buffy's?

"Just seen Buffy," you replied briefly. Best not to say too much.

"Oh, so she still thinks you were acting when you became Faith's boy toy the other week? For the record, I don't trust you, or like you - vampire." The kid's mouth curled into a sneer.

"Keep out of my business, boy," you growled at him, staying mostly calm but not appreciating anyone talking to you like this.

"I may be a 'boy'," he said, walking right up to you. "But at least I'm a human, not a blood-sucking scumbag who has ruined Buffy's life more than once!"

You felt an impulse to teach some respect to this kid, but was it worth it? Remember your mission, you told yourself...
1112222121121112.title: Making out then walking out!

choices: She wants you to plant false information about the mayor to Buffy!
She wants you to turn each of Buffy's friends against her!
11122221211211122.content:
Reasoning that this kid must be a friend of Buffy's - a jealous one at that - you decided it best not to risk anything. Giving him a glare and turning on your heel, you strode away, your black coat billowing behind you. He called something out after you but you didn't even hear it, such were the length of your strides.

Checking out the other demon hideouts did not elicit any more information about Mayor Wilkins for you. Realising that it was now well past midnight: just a couple of hours away from sunrise, you decided to return to Angel's crypt. Ensuring that your (now his) body was secure, and completely unconsious, you settled into bed. Venturing out - very briefly - when dawn arrived, you confirmed with a sharp burn to your skin that you were certainly not impervious to the sun!

When you woke, it was still light, so you used that time to train: a few basic workouts to test your body, reflexes and general strength and speed. You weren't quite at the physical level of your original body, but not far off at all! Would you have bloodlust? Would you need blood or could you eat food? As soon as the sun had set, you tested this - eating food did nothing for you at all. Sneaking into the butchers, you procured some pig's blood: after only a little taste you realised that you both desired and needed this in order to live! You took a few more packs of this, dropped them back at yours, then headed out to the cemetery to meet Faith...

"Well look-ee here...if it isn't Buffy's little boy toy...!" Faith greeted you with a snarl before you could utter a word. Blocking her attack, you realised that she assumed you were Angel!

"No wait, my goddess. It's me - Warlock!" You shouted, creating some distance between you.

She stared wide-eyed at you. "No frickin' way! How d'you...never mind. How do I know it's you?" She paused frowning for a moment.

"Would Angel do this?" You dropped to your knees and placed meek, loving kisses all over her boots.

"He should do..." Faith replied a little coldly. "Okay - it's you. So what you got for me?"

You recounted how you met Buffy, omitting the details of how attractive you found her and the kissing, explaining that you even went to demon hideouts to find out more.

"That's it? Well all that was wicked obvious. Oh that kid you saw was Xander - total dork." She stared down at you, a dominant look on her beautiful face.

"So tell me what to do now, my beautiful goddess. I am yours to command," you said, staring reverently up at her.
11122221211211122.title: Moving on, then the next evening!

choices: You willingly give up your magic.
You try to talk her out of it.
11122221212.content:
You watch nervously as her intelligent eyes flashed excitedly.

"You got some fancy tricks with your magic. I want it."

Blinking in surprise you try to process what she actually wants. Was she capable of magic did she want to grow her talent? Strange you didn't feel any latent magic outside of the fact she was a Slayer.

"Can you clarify... goddess?"

Faith laughed, "It's just like I said. I want your power. I don't know lots about magic but I do know it can be transferred."

You swallow thickly. Magic was who you were. It was an integral part of your fighting style. It also wouldn't be a direct transfer. Yes you could turn her into a warlock, well a witch but none of your skill would transfer over. That had to be learned. It would be far more advantageous to Faith to use you as an ally and henchman.

On the other hand magic was a delightful thing. No doubt Faith would like to be able to blow people away with a wave of the hand. And if you truly wished to serve her wouldn't that entail sacrifice?

You questioned what you should do... willingly give her your magic or try to talk her out of it.
11122221212.title: She wants to absorb all of your magical skill a...

choices: She wants to keep you as a slave!
111222212121.content:
It's impossible to deny this dark-haired goddess; even though there's an undeniable feeling of doubt in your bones, you agree to her demands.

"Yes...goddess! Anything I can do to be of assistance..." You breathe heavily at her, feeling so enamoured with the beautiful slayer.

"Yeah, yeah. Now gimme!" She grins at you, a hand extending towards you, as though you could just hand it over.

"Of course - just give me a moment," you say hesitantly. Faith is clearly expecting to be imbued with your warlock abilities without any complications. Sure, she will be able to control and manipulate the elements, but without the understanding behind it, will it really be effective?

"Hey, come on. You got wicked powers an' all - if you're, like, as loyal as you make out to be, just gimme your magic already!" Faith glowers at you, in a rather spoilt manner, as though she's getting tired of having to wait for longer than she sees necessary.

You suddenly remember a transferance spell a former ally of yours once showed you. Combining it with a magical enhancement procedure should work...not wanting to keep your goddess from waiting, you decide to go for it!

"Ok...here goes..." Grabbing both of her hands, you feel a shivery sensation spread inside you. As her eyes meet yours, you realise that this is your destiny, your purpose: to aid and serve this gorgeous woman! Muttering incantations in Latin, all the while practically lost in her dark eyes, the few minutes that it takes to complete the spell is far too short for you!

Like electricity, you feel a surge of energy emanate from your chest, almost ripping it open as it spreads and showers over Faith, causing her to gasp in an almost orgasmic-like way!

"Wow..." She breathes, falling backwards on to the ground, while you collapse into a heap. "Wow...I feel...totally awesome!" She laughs, almost maniacally. Without warning, jet red streams burst out of an outstretched hand, uprooting a tree completely, sending it flying through the air.

It's worked! You can tell by the fact that you feel depleted, empty, the most vulnerable and helpless that you can remember. Hoisting you up roughly to your feet, Faith stares at you, as though considering what she should do with you...
111222212121.title: You willingly give up your magic.

choices: Accept it - you can still be her slave, just not at this very second!
Beg and plead to be her slave - go all out!
1112222121212.content:
A smirk spread across Faith's pretty features, leaving you more than a little uneasy. Instinctively, you began mentally preparing a spell to protect yourself....but there was nothing left in your tank, much like a toy or game that had been drained of its batteries.

"I can't wait for little miss Buffy pants to taste a load of this!" Faith grinned as she unleashed a lightening bolt from her hand, causing a gravestone to crumble completely.

Lifting yourself slightly from the ground, you knelt before your goddess, which is what she truly was.

"Yeah that's right, bow down like the worm you are..." Faith chuckled as she used a boot to effortlessly knock you back down to a lying position.

With none of your magical powers left, your confidence was completely depleted. She was right; you were a bug, a worm to her. Lying flat on your back, you pleaded up at her.

"Please, goddess, let me worship you..." You whined, wishing more than ever for Faith to allow you to serve her.

"You did give me your powers I guess..." Faith frowned, apparently deep in thought, while she shattered the broken bits of gravestone to swirl around in a circular motion. "And I don't even have to say anything; I just, like, think it...and it totally happens!"

"You're so powerful...so beautiful..." You murmur weakly up at her.

"Yeah I am! Anyway, thanks for the wicked skills. Laters..." Faith turned before strolling casually away from you.

That was it?! The thanks for transferring the huge array of your magical skill and powers to her?!

"Wait! That's all I get?" You cry out at her, forcing yourself back up to your feet in justified indignation.

"What do you want, a medal? Or a badge that says 'I gave Faith my magic'? Is that what you want?" The dark-eyed beauty stared at you, a sneer planted on her face.

"You know what I want...I want to serve you and worship you..." You said, a touch more humbly.

"Yeah, well, not right now. I got stuff to do. Or am I not making myself clear?' Faith tapped her boot impatiently on the ground.

What should you do? Accept her words or continue to plead to be her willing slave?
1112222121212.title: She's done with you!

choices: You can take them! Fight the two female vamps!
Back off and attempt to escape from them!
11122221212121.content:
Not wanting to anger the beautiful, powerful Faith any more than you may already have, you realised that it was just best to accept the fact that Faith doesn't want you to serve her. Not now, anyway.

"Ok," you mumbled in a small voice, staring fixedly at her boot, not wanting to make eye contact in case it displeased the slayer.

"Damn right. Now, like I was saying, I gotta get outta here. Later loser." And with that, she turned on her heel and sprinted rapidly away. All you could do was watch her sexy form disappear into the distance. Sighing, you wished that Faith could treat you with just a modicum of respect - imbuing her with every last drop of your magical powers...and nothing from her - you didn't even get to kiss her boots! Still, she was a goddess and your role was to serve her. Who were you to complain?

Rising to your feet and shuffling away from the cemetery, you resolved to head home, as hanging around here, without any of your previous magical powers, would be a recipe for disaster! Quickening your pace when you notice a couple of vamps loitering around a tall oak tree, you focus on getting home safely.

Ducking down an alleyway, you rued not bringing a stake with you. What if those vampires back in the cemetery saw you?

"Excuse me, young man..." A frail voice called out behind you. You froze, then realised that the owner of this voice was unlikely to be much of a threat. Turning round, you sigh with relief at the innocent-looking old woman, who was holding an empty shopping bag in her hand.

"Would you mind helping me dear? My shopping's dropped everywhere!" She said, wincing with the effort of trying to bend down.

"Sure," you said quickly. Rushing over, you scoop up the food items from the floor and quickly drop them into the carrier bag. "There you go." Smiling, you said your goodbyes before turning back to continue your journey home.

As you turned a corner of the alleyway the sound and sight of something filled you nervousness...

"What a model citizen!" A blonde woman snickered at you standing next to her companion, a tough, sexy-looking brunette. Ceasing any other movement, you blinked with confusion, before realising that the two vampires from the cemetery somehow got ahead of you, and were now blocking your journey home. Normally this would be nothing, but with no special powers, you hastily began to shuffle backwards, keeping your eyes fixed on the two female vamps.

"Ooh, I thought that mister Warlock was supposed to be a tough-ass - and here he is backing away from us!" The brunette grinned before morphing into full vamp mode. "Come on - you're supposed to be a badass fighter...don't you wanna play?" She said, her eyes widening with faux-innocence as the deadly duo moved a little closer...

Your heart thumped wildly...you still had a little distance between them: you could quickly skip back down the alley and be in public view. They would have to back off with other people around! Then again, you may have given up your powers, but you still knew some moves. Even without a stake, you could take out these creatures and wipe the smug smiles from their demonic faces...
11122221212121.title: Accept Faith doesn't need you. Head home instead!

choices: You put up a good fight but you aren't able to win.  Damn.
You put up a good fight and begin winning.
111222212121211.content:
You had learned martial arts. Being able to move quickly and skillfully in conjunction with magic is what made you so damned lethal. Faith had wrecked you in close combat but that was because she moved with Slayer speed and strength. Vampires weren't nearly as strong as a Slayer. On the other hand Vampires were still quite a bit stronger than you were. You were also used to using magic and suddenly having your greatest weapon gone from your finger tips... well this might not end well.

You thought these thoughts as you rushed toward them. Hopefully your martial arts and battle instincts would carry you through!
111222212121211.title: You can take them! Fight the two female vamps!

choices: They want to turn you into a vampire!
They want to kill you but aren't interested in turning you!
1112222121212111.content:
Lunging forward to catch the vampires off guard, you pulled off a crisp snap kick to the blonde's mid section before unleashing a barrage of fists onto her companion. Connecting with your knuckles square into her mouth, she grunted before dropping to the ground.

A sharp pain in your side sent you staggering backwards. The blonde pressed her advantage, punching you in the cheek then kneeing you to the gut. You sank to your knees, gasping in pain.

"I thought you used magic and stuff," the blonde vamp stated simply, looking a touch perplexed, while the brunette hoisted herself up to her feet, a look of fury etched on her vampiric features. Snarling at you, she attempted a roundhouse kick, which you somehow ducked. Rolling away, you swept the blonde vampire to the ground. Anticipating an attack from the other one, you promptly darted backwards to shift your attention to her.

"Get him, Emily!" The blonde called from the ground.

Emily (the brunette) was too quick for you. Holding on to your outstretched arm - an unsuccessful attack from you - the sexy yet deadly vampire hit you with several rapid punches and back fists, bruising and battering your face in the blink of an eye. You tried to create some distance between you, only to be sent sprawling by the outstretched leg of the recovering blonde vampire you swept to the ground moments ago.

You tried to roll away, but a firm boot from each vampire on your back kept you rooted to the ground. Squirming around made no difference - you were trapped on the ground under their feet.

"You got some moves, but I was expecting more," one of them said, rather dismissively. You couldn't tell which one from your angle, belly down on the floor.

"Yeah - still, Kaitlin and I do not appreciate being hit. Now stay still or we'll grind your bones into dust." Emily shouted as she bent down so you could see the dangerous look on her face, which had suddenly transformed to its human state. At least you knew both of their names now! You had to admit that both of these vamps were hot. Beating you down like this had made you feel grudgingly impressed and slightly in awe of them.

"So, what shall we do with this so-called famous vampire killer...?" Kaitlin chuckled as she stepped off you, kneeling down so she could sneer at you, a gloating expression etched on her pretty face...
1112222121212111.title: You put up a good fight but you aren't able...

choices: You wake up as a vampire in their lair.
11122221212121111.content:
Emily gave a theatrical sigh, "Well he wasn't nearly as fun as advertised but he did have some pretty damn good moves for a human."

Kaitlin kept her eyes on your face. "So do you wanna turn him or not?"

Turn you? Turn you into a soulless demon? The thought disgusted you.

"No just kill me!"

Emily grabbed your throat and squeezed.

"Bitch you just sealed your fate. Not only are we going to make you a vampire but we are going to make you our little doggy too. I bet you didn't know that for the first 10 years of a vampires life they are almost blindly obedient to their maker. And boy are you going to be in for it!"

You let out a scream as her fangs sink into your neck...
11122221212121111.title: They want to turn you into a vampire!

choices: Fast forward to a week later - your submissiveness begins to fade!
Time to worship your sires - foot worship, face sitting...something else?
111222212121211111.content:
Snapping open your eyes you felt...different. Your first thought was that your magical powers had returned to you, but it was more than that. It was like there was an electricity flowing inside of you, powerul and captivating. A sense of liberty seemed to swirl around you. Possibilies endless! Sitting bolt upright you soaked in your surroundings. Not much to shout about: dank, musty aromas filled the air; dark, gothic decor and themes dominated the room...

Then it all comes back to you: Kaitlin and Emily turned you into a Vampire! As if on cue, the two femme fatales entered the room. An controllable lust swept over you; you recalled Emily mentioning something about loyalty to their makers. Given that you felt a strong sense of amorousness for them both, it appeared that BOTH of these sexy vampires were your makers...

"Hello doggy!" Kaitlin grinned as she marched over to you. Jumping up to your feet, you gulped and soaked in her beauty. She was truly gorgeous - long, wavy blonde hair that hung gracefully onto her slightly square shoulders. With her hour glass figure, you appreciated just how sexy she was, and cursed yourself for not realizing this before.

"Aw, he looks so cute! So obedient!" Emily chuckled at you. Brushing her long, straight brown hair behind her, she gave you a toothy grin. Without realizing it, you had sunk to your knees before them.

"We're your sires - your masters. You will obey everything we tell you. And you will love it, like a grateful dog! Now lick our boots!" Emily giggled at you.

Shuffling forward, you obliged immediately, lapping your tongue up and down their black leather boots. It seemed right, natural to do this to the gorgeous vamps who now owned you definitively. As you did so, you began feeling conflicting emotions build inside. On the one hand, you felt like a powerful being, ready to explode and explore the world! Simultaneously, a deep submissiveness burned your insides...it wasn't clear to you whether this was due to your need to serve dominant, powerful women (or vampires in this case, technically), or it was the effect of how the beautiful vamps converted you. Either way, you continued your ravenous licking of their boots.

"Ok, doggy. Enough!" Kaitlin clicked her fingers at you, forcing you to stop!

You snapped your head back and gazed up at them, awaiting your next orders...
111222212121211111.title: You wake up as a vampire in their lair.

choices: Their orders at one point contradicted Faith's best interests!
1112222121212111111.content: We'll get to what happened during your week in a moment... but why was your submissiveness beginning to fade?
1112222121212111111.title: Fast forward to a week later - your submissiven...

choices: You are loyal to Faith...try to escape and warn her!
Pretend to go along with it...for now!
Screw Faith! Your submissiveness has faded but you are still with the vamps!
11122221212121111111.content:
Thoughout your week, your lust for the two dominant female vamps did not diminish in the slightest. In fact, after providing you with a fresh human's neck to feed on the other day, your gratitude for them increased after providing you with this new, exciting life!

"Ok, doggy." The name christened to you by Kaitlin and Emily seemed to have stuck. Despite it being dismissive, it was pretty apt to be fair. "Time for us to go out," Emily continued, her wicked eyes flashing with uncontrolled excitement and eagerness.

"Really? Out?" You grinned, thinking about the adventures you could share in with your masters. Not having a soul made things...simpler. Despite being technically dead, you had never felt so...alive!

"Easy, doggy," Katlin chuckled, but not without affection. "You're gonna do what do you best - and what's that?"

"Follow your lead," you replied instantly.

"Good dog! Now where shall we go-"

"I've already thought about that," Emily interrupted her companion. "There's someone who's been pissing me off ever since she allied herself with Mr Mayor. Killing our kind...treating us like crap. Like we're supposed to back off her now?"

You had an uneasy feeling about this, and you were right to...

"Faith!" Kaitlin cried out triumphantly! "Hell yes - I would love to wipe that smug grin from her stupid face..."

Confusion gripped at your insides. Faith was still a goddess to you, despite being a human to your vampire. So wonderully evil; perfection personified! Still, you felt under the thrall of your masters, but the very mention of the slayer's name made you perplexed.

"What's wrong doggy?" Emily asked you, observing you shrewdly.

You paused. For the first time in a week, obeying them did not seem so much like an automatic process all of a sudden. The mention of Faith's name made you feel strangely defiant and protective of her.

"What is it doggy?" Emily asked you again, looking impatient as she placed her hands on her hips. Kaitlin stood next to her, equally unimpressed with your failure to answer them immediately...
11122221212121111111.title: Their orders at one point contradicted Faith

choices: It's Faith! Warn her about the vamps!
It's a girl with a stake...the other slayer...?
It's Emily! She must be looking for you...
111222212121211111111.content:
You simply couldn't control it; despite your absence of a soul, the mere thought of your beautiful Faith being threatened or harmed caused something inside you to snap.

Rushing forward, you took your two sires by surprise. Weaving between them, you managed to duck their outstretched hands.

"Doggy! What the hell!" Emily called after you, but you were already out of their crypt, tearing your way with such speed that their following footsteps soon faded away.

You had one thought, one desire...one goal. Faith! You had to see her, to warn her. In fact, having your mind preoccupied with your gorgeous vampire masters for the past week, you feel the intense need to just be in the slayer's presence erupt. It was as if your obsession for her had been temporarily bottled, while another desire - in the form of the female vamps - had numbed it, and taken your mind away from your true purpose.

However, it was a little more complicated now. In your bones, you knew that you just had to serve Faith. Yet you were a strong, feral creature. Even one-week old vampires had a sense of perverse, delirious power: as though they could do as they pleased. Your bloodlust riding high, you pushed past a group of humans, baring your fangs briefly so that they gasped and squealed in surprise. Where was Faith...?

Deciding to check out the closest cemetary, you searched but to no avail. Knowing Sunnydale well, you swiftly moved around the other cemeteries - there were at least six or seven to check out after all!

A shadowy figure in the distance grabbed your attention; it was definitely female, but was it Faith? Slowing down your movements, you began to edge forward, preparing to intercept this woman, should it be the dark-haired slayer...
111222212121211111111.title: You are loyal to Faith...try to escape and warn...

choices: But you are a vampire - so time to to turn into dust!
She agrees to allow you to serve her.
1112222121212111111111.content:
It was Faith! You cried out, "Faith my Goddess there are..."

That's as far as you got before she leveled her hand in your direction and blew out a blast of compressed air. You try to dodge but weren't expecting an attack like that and it clipped your shoulder and you spun around and crashed into the ground. Faith was almost instantly straddling you stake in hand.

Her stake was raised but she had a strange frown on her face.

"What the hell? You're a vamp?"

"Yes Goddess when you took my magic away from me I was attacked by two vampires. I was unable to defeat them and they turned me."

"Huh that bites for you. Heh, get it? Well I do have to stake you now."

"Wait Goddess please! I still want to serve you and I need to warn you that my sires are going to be coming after you."

She laughed which caused her breasts to do very interesting things.

"You think some vamp bitches scare me? Do you know how jazzed I am on your magic right now? I could take down hundreds without breaking a sweat!"

That was probably true. She already had great fighting skills, Slayer strength, Slayer speed and Slayer stamina. Add your magic to it and she was probably one of the deadliest fighters on the planet. Combined with her natural beauty and confidence she truly was a Goddess.

"I... I understand Goddess. I still wish to serve you in any capacity you want me to. I know I'm a vampire and I no longer have magic but I would love to be at your beck and call."

"You sure are a freaky one. Hmm a Slayer having a vampire minion around. Interesting concept."

Your undead eyes shone with hope...
1112222121212111111111.title: It's Faith! Warn her about the vamps!

choices: Cordelia Chase - the hot, bombshell of a student!
11122221212121111111112.content:
"Hmm, I guess I could let you serve me. But only 'cos you gave me these wicked skills. Normally you would be totally, like, dust right now!" Faith said with authority and slight displeasure as her lips curled.

"Thank you...thank you my Goddess!" You gasped as you stared up at reverently at her.

"Yeah...whatever," Faith grunted as she hopped off you, leaving you lying on the ground and standing over you. "As I've let you serve me, I'm gonna put you to good use, vamp."

"Yes...anything that pleases you!" You say with amorousness and affection.

"Yeah, yeah. You're gonna be my bait. I'll keep you alive if I can, but I can't like, y'know, promise anything."

An uneasy, doubtful feeling entered your gut, but you couldn't refuse her: you had pledged yourself to her - your life was now at her disposal!

"Ok...first I need to deal with little miss Buffy. Or maybe that freakin' useless watcher, Wes. Hmm.. I could actually wipe out those British assholes in that stupid watcher's council." Faith seemed to think out loud, while you slowly lifted yourself up to a kneeling position.

"Right - that's it! You're gonna attack that Giles-wannabe and make him call the council. As soon as they arrive, I'll be ready for those tea-drinking, sausage and mash-eating losers!" She said with triumph, while you bowed down to her.

"Anything...anything for you - my Goddess," you said meekly, staring at her boots, wishing she would let you serve her in a more direct, physical way. Still, if this would aid Faith, then it was a worthy, true purpose and mission...

Less than an hour later, you stalked outside the Sunnydale High School car park. Several teachers seemed to be working late, presumably - from what Faith had told you - including her former watcher, Wesley Wyndam Price. In terms of overpowering him, that should be no issue, especially with your vampire strength. Faith had informed you about his inability to fight, as well as his propensity for screaming like a girl...

You snuck behind a tree, waiting with anticipation as footsteps came towards you. Bursting out to apprehend the person approaching their car, you intercepted...
11122221212121111111112.title: She agrees to allow you to serve her.

choices: You quickly mention that you know Faith! Anything to stay alive!
Something else happens - does somebody else turn up?
111222212121211111111123.content:
"Whoah, do you have any books you need to return, or do you just like hanging around outside high schools?"

The voice caught you by surprise; this wasn't the snooty watcher that Faith had referred to! In fact, the person standing in front of you was just about the antithesis of your intended target: a cute, blonde teenager. Although she looked youthful, there was a worldliness about her, as well as a noticeable trace of power...

"Er, no. I was just...taking a walk," you replied nonchalantly. Being a vampire, this would normally be a chance of an easy victim: a girl in the dark, all on her own, yet you felt compelled to get to know her. "Who are you?"

"Who am I?!" The girl looked incredulous. "You come to my school, hide behind a tree and try to sneak up on me, and you ask who I am?! How abouts I'm the person who you need to totally get away from before she hurts you. As from now," she said firmly, a look of resoluteness about her.

You feel gennuinely in awe of his confident young woman. Although she less darkness about her than your glorious goddess Faith, there was a charisma, a magnetism about her that had you enthralled. So much so, that you stood rooted on the spot.

"Okay...let me guess - a vampire sent by Wilkins? Gimme a break!" She said wearily before pulling out a sharpened stake.

"Wait - how do you know I'm a vampire?" You said stupidly. It then dawned on you...this must be the other slayer - Buffy!

"Man you're wicked conspicuous," she giggled a little before rushing at you, neatly performing a deft scissor kick, which almost literally took your head off!

Collapsing to the ground, you finally at least snapped out of your trance. Rolling to the side, you grabbed a jagged looking branch and threw it at her. Parrying this easily, the girl leapt in the air, somersaulting as she landed behind you. A crunch squarely to your back later and you were once again on the ground, face down this time.

"Not much of a fighter either," she remarked, not unkindly as she turned you over and squatted down so her pretty face wasn't far from yours. She used her strong arms to pin you firmly down.

"Used to be," you grumbled.

"What? Before you were, like a vampire?" Buffy asked you. At least you assumed it was Buffy by now!

"Er...yeah." It felt odd to be having dialogue with somebody who had just physically overpowered you and now had you at their mercy.

"Well, no offence. But you're a vampire - I gotta do what I gotta do..." With that she stood up, her stake pointing downwards, moving towards your heart...

To be fair, you had clearly struck a nerve. "Look - I'm just trying to prove that I do actually know Faith." You spat out a globule of blood, not mentioning the fact that Faith had not told you this information specifically; you had in fact researched it on your own...

Buffy seemed to be thinking the same thing. "That doesn't prove anything. Now will you quit wasting my time and admit that you know jack, so I can stake you already?" A look of boredom had spread over her pretty face. Clearly dusting vamps was completely routine to her.

What else could you tell Buffy? You could mention the magical powers you had imbued Faith with - you knew all of the spells and abilities like the back of your hand. But giving your goddess' chief rival such valuable information...was it worth it just to stay alive?

Your survival instinct had well and truly taken over at this point. Although you hated yourself for about to be betraying your goddess Faith, you knew realistically that you were of infinitely better use alive than mere dust...

"I can tell you more: about her magic powers!" You cried up at the blonde slayer.

"Magic powers?!" Buffy almost burst out laughing. "Like that tramp could ever learn a spell!"

Resentment built with Buffy's unkind choice of words, yet you were still at her mercy; you ignored it and pressed on. "I...I gave her my magical power and skills - it was a spell I did. She has all my powers now."

Buffy frowned. "So you're like a vampire-witch?"

"Warlock," you corrected her. "I had magical powers, gave them all to Faith, then got turned into a vampire."

Buffy's face morphed into a cute grin. "Wow - your life is really complicated! And this is coming from a girl who can only tell her nearest and dearest that she's a vampire-ass kicking super chick!"

You couldn't help but be impressed with this woman. She didn't have the raw sexuality or darkness that Faith possessed, but she was witty and powerful. Being a soulless vampire, you felt a strong amount of bloodlust for her: getting to suck on Buffy's blood, pleasing Faith at the same time would be so sweet!

"So what spells can she do exactly?" She eased up on you slightly, clearly comfortable enough to assume you weren't going to try anything now.

You told her about the various spells that you knew, including the types and effects. As you did so, Buffy's expressions varied from smirks of disbelief to eyes widening with surprise about your level of detail about the extreme amount of power you had handed over to Faith.

"Well, if what you're saying is true, Faith's gonna be like, totally unstoppable," she stated with a trace of alarm in her voice. You allowed yourself to smile: finally this slayer was realising that your goddess Faith was going to destroy her! What happened next?

In a flash she flips head first and slams into the ground.

Defeating her wasn't that easy however. Even though she had just taken a heavy slam she was still the Slayer. Without missing a beat she flips back to her feet and comes at you again. You duck a punch, flip her again and then get forced to accept a bruising kick to your arm that you couldn't quite get away from. Her speed was killer and her strength was greater than your own despite being a vampire.

She does look a bit more worried though as the fight drags on. You snarl at her displaying your fangs.

"Come on Slayer don't tell me one lone vampire has you worried? I don't know what you are fighting so hard if you can't beat me you won't have any chance against Faith!"

"I - I told you what I knew...let me go!" You shouted up at her, genuinely angry that she hadn't released you for now.

"Who said anything about letting you go? You're a vampire: I'm afraid that means you're nothing but dust in my book, buddy..."

Reaching our for stake and arching it back you yelped up at her, completely powerless to do anything about what seems to be your imminent death... Buffy brought the stake down like lightning, only stopping just before the wood began to splinter into your heart...

You weren't the first vampire vanquished by her and you certainly wouldn't be the last!

Your final fleeting thought as you departed this world was of Faith - your beautiful, dark goddess, whom you never got to truly serve as you would have wanted.

As a slave, you had well and truly failed.

You quickly stumbled back, but treading on a twig and causing it to snap, betrayed your whereabouts. Moving right towards you in the blink of an eye, one of your sires began to circle you, a look of frustration on her pretty face.

Still, you were not going to give up so easily! Forcing yourself back up to your feet, you stood in a confident fighting stance, showing that you were not to be intimidated. As these were not in the blonde slayer's direct field of vision, you could perform a subtle object manipulation spell...if she didn't see it coming, it would hit her directly as she was blocking Faith from that angle. It could even kill her! Was that a bit too risky? After a few more seconds of deliberating, you decided to...

1112222122212121212221112.content:
The shards weren't large so it wouldn't be too difficult to move them. With Buffy facing away from the mirror shards she wouldn't see them coming.

"All right just don't hurt Faith!" You say and at the same time let loose your willpower and summon the shards directly at Buffy. You aim the shards so they strike her stake arm causing her to lose her grip on it. The force the mirror slashing into her arm causes Buffy to flinch away from Faith.

Deciding to take no chances you summon a ball of fire to your hand and send it streaking toward Buffy. Buffy, wounded, surprised and bleeding was still able to contort her body to the side. You hadn't dared use this spell against Faith but you had no such qualms about it with her rival Slayer. You detonate the ball of fire right as it passes by Buffy, making her dodge only partially helpful. It explodes into a fireball that expands with terrible heat and power. Buffy's right side suffered some nasty burns and the explosion sent her sailing into the opposite wall. She landed with an ugly crash and you could see that her left arm was probably broken from the crash.

You were a master warlock. Your spells made you the equal of any Vampire and most of the other dangerous monsters of the world. You had been holding back against Faith for fear of harming. You unleash a word of power and darts of pure energy streak toward the wounded Slayer who had to desperately roll away from them. If the darts had struck home they would have went right through her, as it was they had gone right through the floor and wall of Faith's apartment.

With Faith no within the direct line of fire you use a modified version of your compressed air spell to hurl the coffee table, chair and desk at the blond Vampire Slayer. Wounded as she was Buffy couldn't quite avoid the massive furniture hurled at ridiculous speeds. The chair crashed against her leg and she went down hard.

Faith had stood up and you took in a deep breath. You had expended quite a bit of magic here but now Buffy was down with multiple broken bones and a nasty burn. You had not only saved your Goddess but you had brought low he rival. You were already thinking about how Faith might reward you...
1112222122212121212221112.title: Successful - you injure Buffy and Faith is able...

choices: Watch as Faith tortures Buffy all night long.
Faith has only gotten started when someone bursts through the door!
11122221222121212122211121.content:
Faith gleefully approaches the wounded Buffy. She yanks her up by the hair and throws her back against the wall. Buffy started to collapse because she couldn't put any weight on her wounded leg but before she can Faith grabs her by the throat with one hand. With her other she punches her several times in the ribs and Buffy croaks out a cry of pain. Faith leans in close and says. "Whatcha gonna do now B?"

Buffy tries to speak but Faith isn't in the mood. She releases her grip and Buffy stumbles to the ground painfully. Faith leans back and then kicks her hard across the face, shattering her nose. You see blood fly out in an arc as Buffy's head flies backwards and her entire body twists around so she's on her back. Faith isn't nearly done yet.

"Fucking bitch. Always getting in my business. Well it ain't going to happen anymore!"

Faith straddles the weakened Buffy and begins to slam punch after punch in her sister Slayer's face. Buffy is crying out raggedly and tries to push her off with her hands and arms. Faith grins at the weak struggles and traps one of her hands and then slowly breaks each finger in her body.

"PLEASE." Buffy screams.

"Please break your other hand? Sure!" Faith mocks.

Faith repeats the process and Buffy's blood curdling screams send shivers down your spine. You realize they are too loud and cast a spell that will muffle noise outside of the apartment.

Faith looked over at you. "What did you just do witch boy?"

"I made it so sound can't travel through these walls. Forgive me for my presumption Goddess but I did not think you wished to be disturbed."

Your Goddess shrugs, "Good call slave. Now watch what happens if you ever fuck with me."

Buffy was trembling in pain and fear as Faith got up and pulled out her knife. "P-please Faith. Don't do this. No, please, don't."

Faith grinned. "I told you B, you interfered for the last time. Are you afraid to die?"

"Yes." Buffy whispered.

"Well don't worry I promise I won't kill you tonight. I'm just going to have a little fun... tomorrow is when you get to die!"
11122221222121212122211121.title: Faith begins to taunt Buffy and hurt her some m...

choices: She forces Buffy to worship her feet in surrender!
She wants to square off against Buffy so she can beat her down!
She wants you to do something to Buffy!
11122221222121212122211122.content:
You waited with nervous excitement as your Goddess stalked over to you, in an infinitely better condition than her rival Slayer.

Her fist flew quicker than you could gasp. Smacking against your jaw, probably dislocating it, Faith let out a snarl of anger and fury. She stood over you, a bare foot forced against your throat. "What the hell, slave? I'm the one who gets her kicks from beatin' up B, not you!" She spat at you, her toes clamped tightly over your skin so you were forced to gurgle and splutter in pain.

"I...I was only...helping...!" You squealed up at her, feeling your face contort with the pressure she was exerting upon you. A sense of injustice intermingled with the pain you were in; if it wasn't for you, Faith could well be unconscious or even dead by now!

Faith retracted her foot, only to smash it into your mouth, chipping several teeth and making you cough up some of your own blood. "I can handle myself," she raged at you. "I don't need anyone to fight my battles. Y'hear me? You're my slave - you're supposed to serve me - do something useful and tie the blonde bitch up."

Your Goddess was clearly rattled, and you did not dare infuriate her even further. Perhaps the fact that you had achieved something which she had apparently failed to do thus far had struck a nerve. Yes, you took down Buffy - clearly and categorically! Maybe she was suspicious of how much power you possessed, as if she feared you turning on her at some point.... Or it could be that you were reading to much into this! You mused over this as you found some unused cables, twisting them firmly together so that both of Buffy's arms and legs were bound. Wheezing, the force of her foot had made you more than a touch giddy. Not to mention your aching jaw, which felt like it was about to drop off, along with your bloody mouth...

"Done yet?" Faith barked at you, walking over and standing over with her arms crossed, a stubborn look adorning her beautiful face. She truly was a picture of perfection - standing there in her tight white vest top, panties...sexy bare legs and feet on show...it took an effort from you not to crawl over and beg to worship her again.

"Yes, Goddess," you replied humbly, completing the tying up of her nemesis, who was groaning a little as she lay beaten on the apartment floor.

Faith grunted. Standing directly over her fallen foe, a sadistic smile spread over her lips. "So here we are, B. No super friends around to save you. Just you and me. And who won, who's better? ME! I told you that you weren't in my league - it was embarrassin' that you even bothered showin' up here!" She said gloatingly, aiming a stiff kick to Buffy's ribs.

You couldn't help but feel under-appreciated again, yet you said nothing.

"Hmm, what shall we do with little miss Buffy... Ooh I've got just the thing...!" Faith chuckled as her dark eyes moved across to meet yours...

She wants you to kill her, prove your loyalty!
