111222212221212121222111223.title: She wants you to do something to Buffy!

choices: Go through with it - cast the spell and kill Buffy!
Buffy doesn't deserve to die! Make a complete U-turn and take down Faith!
You attempt to kill Buffy but your spell fails!
1112222122212121212221112232.content:
Faith's dark eyes widened as she grunted in what seemed to be satisfaction.

"Y'know what slave, being wicked strong and all, I gotta little job for ya. You do wanna please me, huh?" She raised her eyebrows expectantly.

"Yes...yes...anything you say my goddess; I am yours to command," you gushed at her.

Buffy groaned a little as she attempted, futilely to break away from the cables you had wrapped so securely around her wrists and ankles. It wouldn't be long until she would recover - at least there was nothing this blonde Slayer could do to hurt either of you now!

"Well it's your lucky day. I've got just the thing you can, which would totally, like, prove your loyalty or whatever to me." She smiled seductively at you, a bare foot sliding down her leg. The suspense was almost too much for you, though at the same time, an uneasy feeling had begun to spread to your gut. She was building this up into something pretty major: it was unlikely to be an easy task!

"You need to kill Buffy for me. Then we're totally five-by-five," she stated calmly, though she bit her lip, as if in anticipation.

"Kill...Buffy?" You asked her, not wanting to believe your ears. Sure you had killed before, but it had always been demons, villains - creatures that you had ridden from this world. You had never killed an innocent, a human. Plus, Buffy was helpless...it would be more than a despicable act - were you capable of something like this?

"What's wrong, slave? You not ready to prove yourself?" Faith said, rolling her eyes and flicking her dark brown hair behind her head. It settled in a tousle around her face, giving her a rather wild, almost feral look.

"Can't...you do it?" You gulped at her, regretting such a request instantly when Faith lashed out with a slap across your cheeks. Your face stung, yet you accepted the fact that it was rather foolish to speak up to your Goddess like that.

"Who the hell do you think you are? You're a fucking slave! Well, you say you are - I'm startin' to think that you're all talk. You ain't gonna be of any use to me if you can't follow my orders. Now bow down, kiss my foot and do what I tell you!" She said in a thunderous tone, causing you to drop instantly to your knees in surrender. With quivering lips, you placed a meek kiss on top of her soft foot, tasting her salty sweat drop into your open mouth. Trying to steel yourself, you moved towards where Buffy is laying helplessly on the ground. This was it: your chance to prove once and for all to the gorgeous Faith that you were a worthy slave; you could even get rewarded.

Summoning up your energies, you prepare to release a shard of energy, which would basically make its way towards Buffy's heart, killing her in seconds. You had used a similar variation - in wooden, splintery form to stake vampires before. You were certain it would work, just as you began to mutter a quick incantation, the blonde Slayer looked wearily up at you, a look of earnestness and innocence on her pretty face.

"Please... you're not a killer. Not like her," she croaked up at you, wincing with the effort.

"Do it slave..." Faith said threateningly, after lashing out with a firm kick to Buffy's side. "You've got one chance - do it now and do it right. Or that's it - you'll be the next one begin' for his pathetic life!"

Glancing between the two Slayers, you knew that this was a pivotal moment in your life...what would you do?
1112222122212121212221112232.title: She wants you to kill her, prove your loyalty!

choices: Try the decomposing spell...it would make things a hell of a lot easier!
Decide to drag her body out of the apartment and bury her somewhere!
11122221222121212122211122321.content:
It took some effort, but you resolved to cast your reservations aside. Looking down on Buffy as though she were a cancer, a disease that simply had to be eradicated from your flawless Goddess' life, you muttered in Latin quickly, almost feverishly. Buffy's eyes widened in shock as she tried to plead futilely with you.

"Please...stop! I can help you!" She cried up at you, looking petrified beyond all reason.

Still you ploughed on, finishing the spell within a few more seconds. A ball of energy burst from your open palms, shaping and sliding itself into an elongated form, so that it moved rapidly towards Buffy's heart. Protruding into her chest. your deadly weapon caused convulsions to spread through her entire body; she shook violently as you took her life from her.

"Wicked cool," Faith stated with a gleam in her dark eyes, watching intently as Buffy let out a final gasp before going completely still.

You didn't know what to say - it was a curious mixture of feeling satisfied and guilty at the same time. Your emotions were raw and hard to make sense of; yet you knew that it was the only thing you could have realistically done in this situation to please Faith.

Your dark goddess extended a foot to roll Buffy over, then rested her sole against her heart, seemingly in victory, but also to check if her heart had stopped beating. A satisfied grunt from the brunette Slayer confirmed it: you had killed Buffy.

She turned to you, a look of pure pleasure adorning her beautiful face. "You did good, slave. You're like, totally desperate to please me - even kill for me!"

You knelt before her, feeling so wonderfully inferior to this gorgeous woman. "Yes...yes Goddess: I am yours in heart, body and mind!"

She giggled slightly. "Yeah you are. You're actually kinda cool too - I didn't think you had it in you to actually kill a person. You ain't bad."

You took this as a compliment. "Thank you...Goddess..." Finding it impossible to hold back any longer. you dropped down to the floor, your lips pushing and sliding all over the tops of her feet. You couldn't help it - you had proved yourself as her slave and you just had to worship her.

"Whoah, easy slave!" Faith chuckled, using a bare foot to effortlessly force down your face firmly to the floor. "You've got a body to get rid of now..."

Your heart froze - of course! You hadn't even considered the fact that Buffy's body would need to be taken care of. A nasty slither of doubt and worry flooded into your brain - you were a murderer, a criminal...you just hoped that your obsession for Faith would override these negative emotions!

"Yeah - I'm not havin' a dead body rot in my apartment. You killed her slave - it's your responsibility," she stated firmly.

"Please... please Goddess..." You found yourself whimpering, which was met with an increase of pressure from her foot onto your head, contorting your face and causing you to gurgle slightly.

"I ain't repeatin' myself." With that she stood off you, slinking away before casually sitting down on her couch. "You've got two minutes to get this blonde bitch outta here!"

Two minutes?! Panic engulfed you, yet you were determined to take control of your mental facilities and make the appropriate decision. You could carry out a decomposing spell...but you had never tried it on a whole body before. It would be hugely ambitious. The old fashioned way would be to drag her carcass out of Faith's apartment and hope that you wouldn't be seen...what should you do?
11122221222121212122211122321.title: Go through with it!

choices: The spell works - Buffy's body starts to decompose!
You're too spent...you fail to complete the spell and collapse to the ground
Faith physically stops you from finishing the spell as your time is up!
111222212221212121222111223211.content:
Summoning all of your already somewhat-depleted energy, you rose to your feet, ignoring the throbbing pain in your face. As you stood over your victim, you tried your hardest to remember the necessary incantations required to decompose Buffy's body.

"Ooh - another spell!" Faith called over to you excitedly. "C'mon slave - I'm rooting for you!"

You weren't sure whether she was being sarcastic or not. Anyway, you started to murmur the first few words in Latin, using your finger tips to trace an outline of the body what you wanted to be rid of.

"You're taking like forever - you've only got, like, a minute left!" Your Goddess said, a definite trace of dangerousness in her voice.

Distracted by the time constraints you were under, you lowered your hands and tried to empty your mind, attempting to make it as clear and prepared for magic as possible. Feeling a blissful calm begin to soothe your aching head, you started to get into a rhythm, mixing your Latin with deft, subtle movements that began to cause Buffy's body to tremble a little.

"Hell yeah!" Faith chuckled, almost distracting you, but you were in the zone now. Completely focused on your task in hand, you felt your hands shudder with power, the ground beginning to rumble around the area just in front of you.

"Thirty seconds!" The dark-haired Slayer announced, though you were virtually oblivious to everything around you; your mind was almost at one with your target. You could almost feel the skin and bones from Buffy's dead body begin to melt away.

You found your hands shaking vigorously. This was probably due to the fact that the amount of power you were channelling was so huge, so advanced, that it was beginning to drain away your energy, your life force. Gasping with the strenuousness of it, you dropped down to one knee, your mind frantically pushing and sliding itself against the blonde Slayer's body, feeling it dissolve and destroy it. Even though it didn't look visibly different, you knew that as soon as you'd affected her inner core. the actual decomposition of her body would only take a matter of seconds.

Yet you were wobbling, struggling to remain sufficiently full of energy. Your vision began to cloud over; everything around you was suddenly hazy and incoherent. A piercing sound began to fill your ears, reverberating and echoing away until it was unbearable. It would take a tremendous amount of power, strength and intestinal fortitude to see this through. Without a doubt, this was the most complex, mind-bendingly difficult spell you had ever carried out. And you surely only had only a few seconds yet before Faith would announce your time was up; not that you'd hear her in your current state!

Simultaneously, you knew you were mere moments away from successfully completing this massively ambitious spell. Would you be able to complete it, before the two minutes was up? Desperately willing the spell to work, you had a strange sensation grip you tightly...what if you didn't have the energy to see it through? Whichever way, you were about to find out...
111222212221212121222111223211.title: Attempting to decompose Buffy!

choices: She's done with you - she calls the cops and makes you take the rap!
She realises that you're exhausted - she allows you to recover.
1112222122212121212221112232112.content:
With an inevitable sense of failure beginning to envelop you, your entire body shuddered and trembled as you crashed face first to the ground. Your eyes opened groggily, to see the sight that you dreaded before you: Buffy's body, dead, but not even remotely decomposed!

Exhaustion took over at that point; you felt darkness completely overwhelm you before you passed out...


"Wake up, slave!" A hand slapped you roughly across the cheeks, so hard that it forced a surprised yelp to emit from you.

"What...who?" You groaned, feeling as though your entire body had just been sat upon by a small elephant.

"You useless piece of shit! You've totally failed me!" Faith's voice became clearer as you stared up from the floor at her face: hard and beautiful at the same time. "How the hell am I gonna trust you?"

"Please...I..." You began weakly, before giving up, too exhausted to even form a sentence. Flat on your back and staring up at your Goddess, you had no energy - even keeping your eyes open required a concerted effort.

"That's all you gotta say to me? You're supposed to be wicked powerful and have skills. Just get up and do it already!" She said, glaring down at you, her bare legs and feet making her look ridiculously sexy.

"I...I...can't," You gasped up at her, spluttering and almost choking with the effort. The attempt of this decomposition spell had truly depleted you of everything - it was if you had no batteries left whatsoever. You wished and prayed that your Goddess would understand and appreciate the efforts you had gone to for her...

No such luck! Lifting a bare foot in the air, Faith brought it down with fury onto your stomach, causing you to cry out in agony, a small amount of blood leaking out of your mouth. Before you could even begin grovelling and begging, the dark-haired Slayer repeated this action, making you double over and curl into a ball, pitiful and helpless.

"Didn't you fucking hear me?! You're the most useless slave in the whole fucking world!" She spat at you, completely livid that you were unable to fulfil her request. "Get up now and I'll give you another chance to get rid of the body. Do it!" She yelled at you, her voice totally demanding.

It was no use: you felt like a fish out of water, completely unable to do anything other than quiver and whine on the ground. Hot tears springing from your eyes, you tried to summon some sort of energy but you literally had nothing left in the tank. All you could do at this point was to roll onto your front and attempt to place meek kisses to the top of Faith's bare feet. Shaking you away, your Goddess was clearly not impressed at this attempt to please her.

"Did I say you could kiss my feet? You're unbelievable!" She stared coldly down at you, her harsh expression making you feel even more desperate and anxious than before. "What the hell am I supposed to do with a slave who can't even, like, carry out my orders?"

She had a point, harsh as she was being. You had failed and now you were paying the price!

"Y'know, there's somethin' else I could use you for...?" Faith said thoughtfully, filling your heart with both hope and fear in equal measures. Would your incredibly sexy Goddess show some mercy on you, or use you for something that would be unpleasant or difficult for you...?
1112222122212121212221112232112.title: Too exhausted to complete the spell!

choices: You are taken to jail.  Interrogation time with a female cop!?
You are taken to jail.  You take the fall... but can a jail really hold you?
11122221222121212122211122321121.content:
"You're worthless!"

You hard thought this was fair. You had saved her! You had killed Buffy for her! But she was your Goddess, your dark paragon of beauty, she who must be obeyed.

"I'm sorry... please forgive me."

She kicked you quite viciously. "No you're done."

You lifted your head sorrow in your eyes. "No Faith... no Goddess please I can still serve you. Let me rest and I can get rid of the body. Please give me another chance."

Faith looked down at your snarled. She bent down and cupped your jaw in her hand.

"No."

She gathered the saliva in her mouth and spat full on into your face. Some of it even got in your eye. She stood up and gave one last parting kick and order.

"You're going to take the heat for this bitch. Stay here until the cops arrive and tell them you murdered Buffy. Don't mention me at all."

If this was the last order Faith was going to give you... you would follow through with it.

"Yes Goddess."

"Whatever, hope you enjoy jail bitch."

And with that she walked out of her Apartment to call the police.
11122221222121212122211122321121.title: She's done with you - she calls the cops an...

choices: You cast the spell - it's successful! Now you can run away!
You cast the spell but it fails...uh oh!
111222212221212121222111223211212.content:
The next couple of hours were somewhat of a blur. Once the police arrived, she conveniently slipped away, leaving you to accept the full blame for Buffy's murder. That part wasn't actually that difficult; you had been the one to end her after all! So, after being handcuffed, taken away and dropped into a jail cell, you considered your options...

By taking the rap for your Goddess, you had surely pleased her - this was more than a dose of comfort for you. You knew in your heart that you would do anything, no matter how degrading, extreme or apparently horrendous. Yet, Faith had not specified how long you would need to be in prison for...

Fortunately for you, you were alone in your small, claustrophobic cell. The last thing you needed was to deal with some burly meathead who would undoubtedly want to do something unpleasant to, or with you. Staring up at the ceiling above you, you saw a vent - a long way away, but definitely large enough to fit in! Deciding that the less time you spend in jail the better, you made a choice: it was time to get out of here! Waiting for the prison guard to walk by, you began concentrating on levitating yourself - slowly and subtly.

"Hey, you!" A curt tone took your concentration right away. A towering guard appeared in front of you, his weather-beaten face wearing the expression of a sneer. "You got another hour in here before you're transferred. I hope ya like some company!" He chortled, tapping his nightstick against the metal bars of other cells, causing a clanging sound to ring out and reverberate around the area.

Hoping that no-one else would appear, you began to refocus on your spell. The thought of having to share your cell with others, spurred you on to get the hell out of there! So, deciding to go for broke, you launched yourself upwards, a dull hum causing your arms and legs to tremble a little. A rather glorious sensation started to spread to your belly; you were rising, with some speed - heading straight for the ceiling! As you approached, you threw your hands up, clutching on to the metal bars, so that you were swinging, a bit like a monkey from a tree. Realising that you had to get a move on from this position, you loosened one part until it dropped with a clang to the ground, then deftly propelled yourself forward until you up in the vent. Phew!

Scurrying forward, you heard a surprised cry from below you (presumably the guard had heard you). As you raced along, you eventually came to an opening. Forcing it open, you could see a security fence, surrounded by guards. Shit! If you dropped down from the vent now, they would see you instantly! It could be worth trying a teleportation spell - being able to see a patch of grass in the distance would allow it to be successful enough to then flee away. However, if the spell fails, you will probably make a ruckus, which would alert the guards for sure...
111222212221212121222111223211212.title: You are taken to jail

choices: Yes you make it back home - phew.
No you are stopped... but by who?
1112222122212121212221112232112121.content:
You were dangerously low on magical reserves but you focused all of your will power and with a gasp you succeeded with your spell and were on the other side of the fence. Catching your breath you immediately began to sprint. Likely it would take the guards some time to figure out where you went to.

Luckily for you that was the case. You were badly beaten, exhausted and drained off all of your magic. Your legs burned as you quickly got away from the jail. You needed to get back to your abode and recover. It would take days for your magical abilities to recharge and for your wounds to heal.

Are you able to make it back to your home successfully? Right now you literally have nothing left - if someone stopped you, you would be screwed!
1112222122212121212221112232112121.title: You cast the spell - it's successful! Now y...

11122221222121212122211122321121211.content:
Fortunately, miraculously even, you were able to return home without a single hitch. Breathing a grateful sigh of relief, you collapsed into your bed, sheer exhaustion overwhelming you to the point that you passed out within mere seconds...

After an indiscernible amount of time, you awoke with a pounding headache. Every bone, every fibre of your being not only ached, but felt completely spent. At least you were able to escape jail without too many complications! Then the thought of Faith, your Goddess, entered your mind... you should report to her, show to her how resourceful you are and plead her to allow you to worship her gloriousness once more.

However a nagging doubt began to spread inside of you; Faith made you go to prison - as far as she was concerned, you were out of the picture. Not only had you taken the rap for her, but now you were also a felon: a felon on the run from the law! Was it even safe being at your place? The rational side of you took over - it would only be a matter of time until you would be tracked down....

Your mind made up, you dragged your weary out of bed and mixed together a potion, one which would revive you, temporarily at least. Gulping the red, syrupy mixture down, you packed a few items, including weapons and magical supplies into a bag and headed out of the door. Realising that it was night time, you turned your collar up and tried to keep a low profile as you started searching for Faith.

The most obvious port of call would be her flat. Just as you start heading there, you grind to a halt, remembering that was the actual crime scene, where you murdered Buffy. A horrible feeling of guilt swirled inside your belly: you were a killer, a criminal... slaughtering an innocent girl... was it all really worth it to become Faith's slave...? Attempting to shake those thoughts away for now, you resolved to find the dark-haired Slayer; you simply have to see her!

Walking through the cemetery where you first uncounted her, you considered doing a locator spell but that would expend energy that you definitely do not possess. So the old-fashioned, long, laborious way it would be: track and find! A voice in front of you made you freeze. Was it Faith? Part of you yearned to rush out and drop down to your knees in humble servitude, but what if it was someone else? Creeping forward slowly, hiding behind a tombstone, you are close enough to see that the person making the noise was...
11122221222121212122211122321121211.title: Yes you make it back home - phew.

choices: It was someone else connected to Buffy.

Who could it be that was linked to Buffy?

Willow - A witch with incredible power. In one of the seasons a villain murdered her lesbian lover. She went crazy and became a dark witch with nearly limitless power. Would the murder of Buffy break out the big bad Willow?

Or would it be someone else?

choices: The nightmare (what did you dream about in detail).
It was bad - but lets move on meeting Faith again!
11122221222121212123.content:

The Captain Archer era is the foundation and formation of Starfleet. Here the groundwork will be made to determine what kind of Federation will be started. Your actions here will shape the federation into what it will become. Chose your actions wisely for the fate of the galaxies are in your hands. Be also warned of possible incursions from hostile alien races from this time period and beyond.

The Captain Kirk Era is present day Starfleet. In this Timeline the Federation enjoys unrelenting prosperity. Expansion and exploration are the key drives now. Be careful not to violate the prime directives of peace though for the cold war with the Romulans and the competitive struggle with the Klingon's will result in all out intergalactic war.

The Next Generation Era. With Starfleets most powerful ships ever, far reaching deep space stations, and routes to never before reached quadrants of space, the Federation has made a reputation of itself as being the peacekeepers of the universe. A blessing and a burden. For now every system known relies on Starfleet to provide peace, justice, and supplies. With resources stretched thin from many wars it is only a matter of time before nipping dogs at it's heals become a threat the Federation cannot survive.

1131.content:
Captains log. Stardate 2158.4 (side note this is 3 years before the formation of the Federation)


“Captain Adam Kilgore reporting. This will be my first command on board the Valkyrie. A Daedalus class starship. *Computer Pause* (What was Starfleet thinking? Being a new ship of the line in a time of war gives little time to properly test out a new design before thrusting it into combat). ~Sigh~ *Computer Resume* Our mission is to rendezvous with the fleet at Tarod in preparation for our first major offensive against the Romulan Star Empire. *Computer Pause* (A new crew, an aging NX fleet, and superior Romulan forces against us... what possible victory does the Federation hope to achieve)? *Computer Resume* With any luck we will finally turn the tide of this war in our favor.”

*BEEP*

“End log. Enter.”

The sliding bulkhead door hissed open revealing First Officer T’Lar. A Vulcan female approximately ninety years of age. Being that the typical Vulcan lives well over two hundred years she would be considered by human standards in her mid thirties. Despite her relatively youth she has proven herself to be quite the dutiful second in command. Of course, what can you expect from a race that is taught to suppress all emotion in favor of total logic?

Taking a full glance of her you notice she is attired in the standard issue federation uniform (http://ts1.mm.bing.net/images/thumbnail.... ) though her rather voluptuous mounds on her chest protrude every so slightly. If only to draw your attention away from her rather obvious pointed ears. T’Lar’s long, flowing, brunette hair almost makes you weep that she is not human. Her cold, glossy blue eyes, cat-like in shape, reminds you of this fact and adds to her people’s characteristic non-emotional personality.
http://www.elevenfreakinthousand.com/Kir...


Handing a pad over to you, “All preparations have been completed Captain. At current speed we will be at the rendezvous point in 6.37 hours.”

“Very good T’Lar. You have an impeccable talent for accuracy and efficiency.” You jest with her lightheartedly only to receive the same cold blank stare in return.

“Fascinating.” She replies monotone, “The Human compulsion for irrelevant humor never ceases to amaze me.”

“All work and no play T’Lar… it means you have to have a little fun now and again.”

Suddenly you feel the ship jolted violently, knocking you on the floor with T’Lar on top of you. Followed shortly thereafter by incredible shaking akin to that of an airliner of the old Earth days hitting turbulence. Data disks fly off the desk hitting the walls and floor. Lights blink off only to be superceded by the emergency lighting a few seconds after. The sound of grinding metal, bubbling booms, and strange whining saturates your ear drums.

Then it comes.

An ear shattering alarm to Red Alert. A call to Battle Stations. Easier said than done. The ship, though no longer at Warp speed still felt like it was going at super fast impulse only sideways. Equilibrium was off. Everything tilted to the left and down with the angle getting steeper by the second.

You had to get to the bridge.

Grabbing T’Lar by the arm you get up to the door. Pressing the Initiator Button the bulkhead door to your Ready Room, you pull T’Lar through by sliding yourself against the metal wall using the rail grating as leverage. Getting to the next bulkhead door you again push the Initiator Button.

The scene that opens up before you is pure chaos. Panels, vents, lighting, even the floor itself seemed to be exploding. http://www.scifidimensions.com/Dec02/exp... You saw wounded and dead crew members flying every which way. Screams, of pain and fright, overshadowed by the deafening sounds of metal hitting metal and explosions, were coming in from all directions.

It was only when an explosion from behind you knocked both you and T’Lar on the Command Deck floor that you rolled over to see the Valkyrie’s commencement plaque. On it were the Latin words: “Res gesta per excellentiam.” Achieve through Excellence. That’s when you knew you had to take control back of your ship and re-establish order. This is your first command and you were not going to let it end like this. Not this soon.

“REPORT!!!” you shouted at the top of your lungs as you crawled yourself to the Captain’s Chair.

Your navigation officer, Ensign Maria Jones, “CAPTAIN!!! We’ve been hit by high level plasma burst. It’s knocked us out of warp into a high velocity spin. Attempting to compensate!” (What she looks like: http://ts1.mm.bing.net/images/thumbnail....)

“T’Lar, find out who shot at us! I want damage reports people! Engineering! Give me more power Damnit!”

http://bbsimg.ngfiles.com/1/20188000/ngb... Replied the voice of your Chief engineer Shanene Jones. (No relation to your pilot). “Captain. Main power is offline. Warp Core is currently unstable. Will have to rely on reserve energy til we can re-initialize it.”

“Captain.” Interrupted T’Lar, “Sensors are offline. Life support at minimum. Weapons and shields are at 25% and falling.”

That’s when the flicking screen in front of you showed you an image of http://images.wikia.com/startrek/images/... through the sparks and haze of your damaged bridge.

Who was it?
1131.title: U.S.S. Valkyrie  (NCC - 101)

As you watched the funerel procession your eye caught the Queen. She was wearing mourning clothes of black velvet. She looked stunning. Instantly your heart was won over. The woman had lost her husband, her son and now her father. You swore then and there that you would make this woman's dreams come true.

You knew she had promised Lordship to whoever brought her the head of her treacherous brother Tyrion Lannister. The cruel dwarf had killed his owned father and it was sad that Cersei was mad with rage. You could go after him... but hunters from across the seven kingdoms were already looking for him. Perhaps there was something more you could for her here in person.
12213.title: A Feast for Crows (Book 4)

choices: You don't catch him... the hunt is on.
122131.content:
You put your knowledge of the way the world works to good use. You realize that Tyrion would not be foolish enough to remain in the seven kingdoms. No he would flee as quick as possible.

Knowing this you realize you need to hire a fast ship and overtake them at sea. You are confident if it came to a battle you would win handily however the sea is a big place and you aren't certain of where he is going.

You hire a swift ship and soon you are on your way. Do you catch up with the vile dwarf's vessel? Or does he make it to whatever his destination is?
122131.title: Look for Tyrion.

choices: You return to King's Landing with Tyrion as your prisoner.
1221311.content:
Your vessel quickly catches up to the accursed dwarf.

Battle was a quick affair. With you at their head the boarding party trounced the defenders. You then kicked open the door to Tyrion Lannister's chamber. The pitiful excuse for a man was drunk silly.

"Care for a drink?"

You scowl down at him, "I'm here to take you to face justice."

The small man gave a bitter laugh, "Justice? Oh that's rich. Next you'll tell me that all knights are good and virtuous."

"Do you deny killing your father? What of your own nephew? Forcing yourself on that poor woman? You disgust me."

Tyrion gave another laugh, "The father yes, the whore was willing and while I didn't kill the sodding bastard Joffery, I should have."

You shake your head in disgust, "No man is as accursed as that of a kinslayer. I'm to take you back to King's Landing, there you will face your sweet sister's justice."

What happens next?
1221311.title: You catch him at sea.

choices: You meet with one of her councilers.
12213111.content:
You arrive in King's Landing. The dwarf had sobered up and had tried to buy his way to freedom. Promises of gold, information and even power did not sway you. It wasn't like he could make good on the promises and all of those things were unimportant compared to your love of the Queen.

You and half a dozen of your men marched through the streets. The dwarf was in a large sack as to not cause a riot. He was hated in the streets of King's Landing and with the promise of Lordship the crowd would go mad in trying to claim him. A blade was at your hip and you were dressed in boiled leather and a chain mail. You had bathed, and your short hair was free of dirt and grease.

Several guards stopped you as your approached.

"State your business."

You nod your head respectfully and say, "I have a gift for the queen. I have captured Tyrion Lannister and bring him to face the Queen's justice."

One of the guards rolled his eyes, "You'll be the 8th person to come claiming they have the dwarf. Is it even a dwarf this time or just an ugly child?"

Taken aback you say, "Ser, I promise you this is the real Tyrion Lannister and I respectfully request an audience with the queen."

"Yeah yeah, wait here sell sword."

You were irritated with his tone but you were not a man to be overly concerned with slights. Nothing could dampen your good mood. You were about to meet the Queen, the object of your love and desire. The lordship meant nothing except as a means to an end, and that end was to provide additional service to the benefit of Cersei.

Finally after a long wait the guard said, "You may come in but leave your guards here."

You lift the sack that contained the Imp and said, "He's still alive."

The guards looked shocked but quickly opened the bag and made sure he was bound. Of course he was, you were no fool. One of the things you needed to talk to the queen about was just how foolish and incompetent the guards around the palace were. But that was for later, for now you were just moments away from being ushered into the presence of the fairest woman in the world.
12213111.title: You return to King's Landing with Tyrion as...

choices: You are given a place on the small council.
You are made into a knight and will serve as a soldier.
122131111.content:
You are ushered into the throne room where you saw the object of your devotion.

The queen sat next to the iron throne in a gilded chair of her own. Her blond hair fell like gold down her body. Her piercing green eyes shone with calculation and malice, you found this fitting considering the evils her brother had wrought. Her son lay dead at the Imp's hand, malice should be in those gorgeous green eyes. Her skin was fair and her gown made of red silk. A golden necklace with a ruby glittered above her cleavage that was artfully exposed for the world to admire.

You immediately knelt and bowed your head. "My Queen," you hoarsely spoke.

The Queen rose regally and spoke, "Show me his face," she demanded.

The guards opened the bag and took out the tightly bound Tyrion Lannister.

The Queen shivered for a second, "It is you. Finally. You will die for what you did to my son!"

The Imp laughed, "The one crime I am innocent of sister. The one crime I wish I had done myself. He was a monster and the realm is better off with him a corpse."

One of the guards angrily hit the dwarf with the haft of his spear. The queen's eyes glittered, "I will not give you a chance to escape again. Bring me his head Ser Meryn." One of the white cloaked guardians of the King swept forward took out his blade and hacked at the dwarf. It took two blows but then the Imp was decapitated. Ser Meryn presented the the head to the queen who nodded and told him to dispose of it.

You remained on your knees as Queen Cersei looked to you.

"And who might you be."

"Your Grace, I am your humble servant. I go by the name Jared. I am pleased to have brought your vile brother to justice."

You remained kneeling and the queen approached you and motioned you to rise. You stood up from your knees and the queen looked at you. "I have promised to make anyone a lord if they bring me my brother. You have done so."

You bow your head again, "My Queen, I am honored beyond words. If you would make me a lord I would be glad to accept the honor. However my true desire is to serve you. I can serve as an adviser. I can serve as a warrior, a soldier. I will serve and be your truest servant in all the realm, be it advising, making war or cleaning the chamber pots of the castle."

The queen laughed and the court joined her.

"I am pleased to find such zeal in these days of treachery. I will honor my decree, you shall be made a lord. And then I am sure we can find a use for such a loyal servant of the crown."

After you are made a lord what does the queen have you do?
122131111.title: Time to meet the Queen!

choices: You speak up risking her displeasure.
You remain silent - you should not contradict her.
1221311111.content:
For your act of bringing the foul traitor to justice you were made a lord. As you had no formal surname you chose "stoneshield" after the Queen's home of Casterly Rock. You were given some lands and seat of power in the River Lands but that war torn area was not yet under the crowns control. Not that you cared of course the greatest honor that was bestowed to you was being named to the Small Council.

The Small Council was the collection of advisers to the queen.

Grand Maester Pycelle was the eldest. Ser Harys Swyft was to act as the Hand of the King. Gyles Rosby was the treasurer and Lord Qyburn was the master of whisperers. Rounding out the council was the Aurane Waters, the Grand Admiral. A bastard but one that was dashing and bold.

Of the lot of them you respected few. Qyburn was the most capable the rest... well you hoped you could provide better council.

Your position was not formally listed however you were to attend the Small Council and advise the queen.

The Queen came in looking brilliant as usual. The council rose and your heart jumped into your throat.

"My Lords you will forgive my lateness," the council readily agreed. When they had finished their pleasantries you knelt to the ground, "Your grace, there is naught to forgive, we serve as you see fit."

You could see Aurane Waters rolling his eyes as your remark. No doubt he thought your words the worst sort of fawning. Only they were true, this is what you had longed to do. The Queen graced you with a smile and motioned for you to rise.

"You all know our newest member, Lord Jared Stoneshield. He valiantly hunted my murderous kin and brought him here to face the sword."

The other council member's nodded their heads in your direction.

"What is the first order of business," the Queen asked.

Talk began about delivering the head of Gregor to Dorne and then went on to discussion on who would be the next High Septon, the head of the official faith of the kingdom. You cared little of such matters since they were not pivotal. Instead you took the time to weigh what each councilor said to learn how effective they were. Your initial assessment was correct, Qyburn was really the only good fit. The Hand was a fool. Waters was glib but you did not trust him.

Next was talk about the fleet which had been decimated at a recent battle. The Grand Admiral wanted coin for ships. You saw the Queen weigh the request when the master of coin spoke, "There *cough* isn't *cough* any *cough* coin." Lord Gyles had a chronic cough that made listening to him grating. The Queen pursed her lips and said, "We must have strength on the sea, I will defer payments to the Iron Bank and to the Church until our fleet is reconstructed.

Ser Harys Swyft agreed readily. Pycelle spoke and said, "The Iron Bank is not to be trifled with... the Iron Bank will have its due, this will cause much trouble."

The Queen did not like the council of the old man and slammed her hand on the table. "The Iron Bank is remains on Braavos, it will wait on our pleasure."

This made you uneasy. The Iron Bank truly was a force in the world. They could cut funding to merchants from the seven kingdoms and wreck havoc on the economy. Furthermore they could fund rival claimants to the throne. You saw that the Queen was fairly set in her position and unlikely to be swayed. However you knew that this course of action could be ruinous. Do you speak up and give good council at the risk of earning the Queen's ire?
1221311111.title: You are given a place on the small council.

choices: She disagrees with your plan and orders you to be silent.
12213111111.content:
While you did not want to displease the Queen you did want to give council.

"Your Grace, I agree the fleet must be constructed. However we must find an alternative to missing a payment with the Iron Bank. I have sailed across the seas protecting merchant cargo, many merchants purchase goods with loans from the Iron Bank. Should they be unable to borrow it could be disastrous for the Seven Kingdoms."

Ser Harys Swyft chuckled, "Lad just because you have been honored with a seat does not mean you know about trade." His patronizing tone irritated you. The fool was unsuited to be the Hand, you suspect the reason he was given the position was due to repaying political favors to the man's family.

"I may be common born my Lord Hand however this does grant me a unique perspective." You turn toward the queen, "Your Majesty again I beseech thee, pay the shipwrights but not with the gold due to the Iron Bank Braavos."

The Queen did look displeased however she said, "Very well then, where should the coin come from?"

"The Tyrells, loan money from them. They have the wealth for it as their lands have remained virtually untouched from the rebellion. Should they object, you can remind them that the crown needs those funds to safeguard the realm."

Aurane Waters snorted, "And show weakness to High Garden? Foolishness."

You are quickly getting tired of these pack of fools but you hold your temper. "Grand Admiral, how would this be weakness? That the crown is in debt is no secret. Moreover the Tyrells will have all that much reason to ensure King Tommen's rule if the crown was indebted to them."

You had argued well your point. Most of the Councillors dismissed your reasoning simply because of their predispositions to you. They viewed you as undeserving of a place on the council but the only one who truly mattered was the Queen Regent, Cersei the ruler of the realm and your heart. What would she decide?
12213111111.title: You speak up risking her displeasure.

choices: Attempt to reason with the queen one more time.
122131111112.content:
"I will not show weakness to our allies. Now be silent until I ask for your consul."

You bowed your head. You disagreed but your low birth was influencing everyone's opinion of your perspective. This did not lessen your loyalty to your queen, the embodiment of perfection, but it did mean you've have to be more strategic then just providing your direct opinion.

The council wrapped up its business and everyone was dismissed.

The Iron Bank always got his due - a missed payment from the crown would be disastrous. But what could be done now that the queen had ruled?
122131111112.title: She disagrees with your plan and orders you to ...

1221311112.content:
You are given a place within the palace guard itself. The queen has given you a score of men and your task is to protect the inner palace from all threats and assassins. The Kingsguard have the privilege of guarding the royal family itself but you will be a layer of outer protection against any who seek to harm them. You are pleased with the position because it allows you to be close to the queen often.

The queen was every bit the gorgeous commanding woman of your dreams. She brooked little dissension among her advisers. She was in absolute control and reveled in the power that was so her rightly hers. While you would never question her wisdom you thought perhaps her council was too weak to properly advise her. Some of the decisions were made without full knowledge of the implications. She had turned away the Bank of Bravvos and refused to pay on the debt until the war with the rebellious lords was complete. As someone who has traveled far and wide you knew this would cause problems.

You also disliked how lax some of the Kingsguard acted. Ser Osmund Kettleblack had implied he was bedding the queen! Such an outrageous lie! The very thought of that coarse fool laying with her royal majesty soured your stomach. You thought about confronting the fool but perhaps it was not your place to question him. He had done the queen a great service that was a mystery still but if he was on her good side it may not be wise to risk her displeasure. For that was the one thing you dreaded above all else. Disappointing your queen the fairest woman in all the land.
1221311112.title: You are made into a knight and will serve as a ...

choices: Cersei is impressed with your skill and  wants you to kill someone for you.
12213111121.content:
You would not allow Ser Osmund to defile Cersei's reputation. It was a violation of his vows and loyalty to the queen. Perhaps it had been in jest but if so it was an awfully poor one. You approached Ser Osmund after he finished his shift of guarding the young king. As always when coming from duty he wore the full plate of the Kingsguard. Their glistening white garb showing the world that they were member's of the elite that had but 7 members.

Ser Osmund was not alone he was walking with his brother Ser Osfryd, commander of the city watch. His clothing was dark in comparison - both brothers were tall and powerful figures in King's Landing. Ser Osfryd wore leather armor - clearly not on duty.

As you approach you say, "Ser Osmund, I would have a word with you."

Ser Osmund smirks, "What is it palace guard?" It was a deliberate slight. You had been raised to nobility and given a command - a small one but it would have warranted a "my lord" at the very least. Not that you cared about titles - that wasn't why you brought Tyrion to justice.

"In private," you respond.

Ser Osmund chuckles, "Anything you have to say you can say in front of my brother."

Annoyed you went on, "Very well. I overheard your early conversation regarding the queen. Comments like those could be taken the wrong way, as a knight of the Kingsguard it is your duty to protect the queen's person and her reputation."

Ser Osmund laughed loudly. "I am a knight of the Kingsguard you up jumped toad. I can speak of the queen in anyway I please, after all I can take her anyway I please as well!"

You saw red, in a blur of motion you had backhanded the boasting fool across the face. The blow split his lip and caused him to fall off balance, he caught himself on the wall and looked at you with murder in his eyes. His hand darted to his blade and he drew it in one smooth motion striking out at you. Ser Osmund wasn't a novice at the blade but he was no where near your equal. You caught the blow with your own blade and then shouldered into Ser Osmund. He stagged back and fell to the ground. His brother snarled at you and launched a blistering attack. You parried each blow with ease then pinned his blade to the wall with one hand while driving your fist into stomach. The leather armor probably prevented him from losing his lunch but he gasped pathetically and crumpled to the ground.

Ser Osmund struggled to his feet in the heavy armor and called out for reinforcements. He charged at you and you stopped his charge with pure strength. While you did not appear to have an overly muscular frame, it was a lean strength with not an ounce of fat. After checking his blow you launched your own combination attack that had him backing away fear glistening in his dark eyes. Seeking to end the matter before more guards arrived you disarmed him with a trick you picked up in Lys and his sword went clattering down the hallway. Not done with your object lesson you stomped the side of his leg near the ankle, the armor stops the blow but doesn't stop his leg from buckling and forcing him to his knee.

You rest your blade on his neck and look directly at him. "If I ever hear you besmirch the name our queen again with your foul slander I will cut you to pieces Kingsguard or no. Do you understand me?" He nods frightfully and you re-sheath your sword just as some of the palace guard arrive. They are actually your men so you dismiss them after informing them it was a false alarm.

You leave the two brothers without a second look.

Several hours later you are summoned to Queen's chamber.
12213111121.title: Confront Ser Osmund

choices: You have a vistor before the morning.
122131111211.content:
When the messenger arrives your heart speeds up. It is always a privilege and and honor to be in the queen's presence. When you arrive there are three Kingsguard in the room with her. Ser Osmund, Ser Meryn Trant and Ser Loras Tyrell. As is your custom you immediately bow your head and drop to one knee. "Your Majesty."

The Queen rises from her chair and orders you to remove your weapons. Puzzled you obey and undo your sheath letting it fall to the floor. You also remove the hidden dagger in your boot and up your sleeve. Ser Meryn Trant takes your weapons away from you. Still on your knees you wait at the Queen's pleasure.

"I have been told that you assaulted a member of the Kingsguard and the Commander of the Watch."

You are stunned that Ser Osmund would tell the queen of the encounter. Surely he did not want her to know about his slanderous talk?

The queen went on, "You have done me a service but that does not excuse you from assaulting my guard and the watch commander. I am tempted to throw you into the dungeons for you stupidity and gall." This was not fair! You had only been trying to protect the queen's reputation. You try to speak but the queen slices her hand in the air. "SILENCE!" Of course you obey and stay silent.

The queen paces back and forth, "Ser Osmund what do you think I should do with him?"

The knight grinned at you smugly. "A service does not excuse treason. Execute him."

The queen looked at you and shook her head, "Not without a trial, it would look as if we were trying to renege on our promise of land and title to my brother's killer. It would have to be public and I weary of another spectacle."

Ser Loras spoke up, "Your grace, trial by combat would be fitting and quick."

Ser Osmund nodded, "Yah that would be fair. I'd be more than happy to fight on your behalf your grace. We can do it on the morrow in front of court. Would make the other nobles understand the price of treason."

If only you could talk... but your queen had ordered your silence and you would rather die then disobey her. The queen nodded, "Very well - take him to the dungeons and tomorrow he will duel you."

Burning rage filled your eyes. Ser Osmund had lied about the encounter. The idiot wanted to duel him, fine he would destroy the ignorant dog. Your very own guards were called in to shackle you and send you down into the dungeons. Ser Osmund went down as well.

"Your pretty quick with the blade so I'm going to make sure our little duel doesn't go awry... still shackled and unarmed he and several of the city guard set to work beating you. They kept away from your face but they hit you hard from the neck down. They cracked several ribs, and bruises lined your body when they were done. Ser Osmund gave you one last vicious kick dislocated your shoulder.

"No food and water, lets see how he fights with busted up ribs and no food, also wake him every hour. No rest for the wicked!"

It was a long night. After they left you forced your shoulder back into socket painfully. Pain only fueled your rage. Ser Osmund thought he had won but he was very mistaken. Very mistaken indeed.
122131111211.title: Cersei is upset with you.

choices: Yes - You will have the greatest honor of your life!
No -  The Kingsguard is not the place for you.
1221311112111.content:
The guard helped you with your armor. The weight of it was painful with your broken rib but you did not grimace. You left your face bare of a helmet - you did not need one. The sword you were given was not your own carefully honed blade, this was duller than a butter knife. Ser Osmund had left nothing to chance, or so he thought.

The court had assembled and the charge of treason was read and a plea was asked for.

In a loud clarion voice you proclaimed, "I am innocent. It is Ser Osmund who has lied to the Queen about the events that took place. Worse he has slandered her name with words I will not repeat in court so foul was his slander. When I slay him in a duel under the gaze of the seven all will know this truth. He turned to the queen and knelt. "Your majesty I would never betray you, you are the all that is noble and good in the world." He rose and faced Ser Osmund.

He saw Ser Osmund was worried. This was not the movement of a man who had been beaten half to death. As the priest finished the words the battle began. Ser Osmund lashed out hoping to end it quickly. You dodged to the side, suppressing a wince from the armor on your rib. He lashed out and you parried the blow, steel rang on steel. Ser Osmund launched another attack, you dodged and responded with a vicious strike to the head that he blocked with his shield. You fought back and forth - your speed was greater even while weakened.

Ser Osmund snarled and rushed you. The fight had gone on long enough. You had been holding back up until know. Your blade darted like an adder to his face. He raised his shield to blow while trying to strike you with his own blade. Your attack was a feint and with his vision blocked by his own shield you easily darted to his shield side. When he lowered it he turned around in a panic but you had already brought your dull blade down with unbelievable force on the back of his leg. It struck right where the joint was, where the plate armor was thinnest to allow for movement. The dull blade pierced his leg and it collapsed under him.

He made a last desperate lunge at you but you were already moving. Your hand snaked around his helmet and you removed it. He lashed out with his blade but now hobbled it was pathetically easy to avoid. After removing the helmet you had easy access to his face. His next strike you caught the blade with your own and then disarmed him. You twisted his arm behind his back and shoved him up against a pillar. Then you slammed his head into it three times. Teeth and blood fell from his mouth. You threw him back down to the ground.

"THIS IS WHAT HAPPENS TO THOSE WHO BETRAY THE QUEEN!"

You stalk forward and grab Ser Osmund by the throat and drag him in front of the queen. "Look at her, look at the one you betrayed with your LIES!"

Ser Osmund moaned pitifully and begged the queen to save him. The queen looked away in disgust. As soon as she looked away you snapped his neck like a twig. You then kneel before the queen.

"Your Grace, I have but one wish and that is to serve you. Allow me to take this traitors place on the King's Guard." The object of your perpetual obedience and adoration pursed her luscious lips an considered the request. Is her answer yes? Or no?
1221311112111.title: The duel!

choices: News arrives at court about an attack by the Greyjoys.
The Queen gets drunk while you are on guard.
12213111121111.content:
The queen nodded her head, "Bravely done Ser Knight, I would be glad to have one so skilled guarding me and my own. My dear brother will advise you of your duties."

You thank the queen profusely and swear to protect her from all harm. You are dismissed and you go to see Ser Jaime Lannister the Lord Commander of the Kingsguard. The queen's brother had lost his hand but he was still a feared figure, his fighting ability was legendary. You met with him and he was... a bit different then what you had expected.

He praised you for ridding the Kingsguard of such an incompetent fool but he also was on his way out of the city. Apparently he and his sister had quarreled about something. Thinking to be polite you said, "Your place is here but I am sure the Queen wants to use your reputation to put down the last remnants of the fighting in the Riverlands." The commander of the Kingsguard shook his head, "You are as blind as I was. Guard the queen and her son, she is not well loved."

You disagreed completely but nodded your head at the direct order. You were excited and pleased to be fitted in the white armor of the Kingsguard. Hopefully your position would allow you to be in constant contact with the Queen. Your heart was filled with joy at the prospect of serving the Queen.
12213111121111.title: Yes - You will have the greatest honor of your ...

choices: She gives you leave to attack the Ironborn.
She refuses and requires you to stay and protect her and her family.
122131111211111.content:
You had been a sworn brother of the Kingsguard for less than a week when word arrived that the treacherous Greyjoys had attacked the Shield Islands guarding the path to the Arbor. You saw a calculating look appear on the Queen's lovely face. You kept the stoic visage of a loyal guard but inwardly you smiled at her Grace's cunning. She was already turning disaster into an advantage.

Soon her plans unfolded. She was refusing her daughter in law and Ser Loras Tyrell from having the fleet sail towards High Garden to protect it from the Ironborn.

"With Stannis still a threat I dare not have the fleet sail from Kings Landing."

Margery nearly shrieked in anger, "He is no longer a threat! My home lies under peril - do something!'

Queen Cersei responded, "Not until Dragon-stone falls - we can not take chances."

Ser Loras chivalrously slammed his fist to his mailed chest and sunk to one knee, "My Queen, allow me to personally lead the attack. I will waste no time in tearing down the walls so the fleet can then be sent to stop the Greyjoys." His sister gasped. You were curious. The queen did not like Ser Loras. You wondered why - was it because she doubted his loyalty? If so he would kill the boy himself. You chide yourself internally letting nothing show on your face. Yes he was young but he was a knight and quite skilled. Not as skilled at you but truly no longer a boy. Whatever the case may be you stood ready to serve the perfection that was Queen Cersei.

The Queen graciously gave Ser Loras leave much to Margery's fear. Her brother was being sent to the front lines, and doubtless she would miss him here at court. You ponder the events as the rest of the folks left the area leaving the Queen and you alone. You could tell that she did not want you to volunteer in place of Loras, no it was clear she wanted Loras gone. But the attack on the holdings of High Garden... well she might wish her tentative allies to sweat a little but he doubted she wished the Ironborn to succeed in pillaging the most wealthy harbor in the realm. And so you decided to speak.

"Your Grace, my place it at your side however I am no stranger to the sea. If you command it I can take my own ship and a small group of mercenaries I know are worth their salt and harry the Ironborn. They are used to easy victories and will not expect the turnabout knowing the King's Fleet is here."

The Queen looked startled at the suggestion. She looked you over again - a close look. You could tell she didn't quite trust you yet - even after slaying the treacherous knight. You still thought it was a mistake to leave his two brothers alive and serving the queen, if one was a traitor likely all would be traitors. You had to be honest with yourself however, they weren't truly traitors expect in the offense of speaking ill of the queen. The knight likely would have served loyally but to speak ill of Cersei required death. Even if the boasts of actually fornicating with the queen were unbelievable...

The queen was poised to make a decision. While you hated to be apart from her gorgeous perfection - you itched to lay waste to her foes. Whatever her decision you would not argue - she was the queen and you were her utterly loyal servant.
122131111211111.title: News arrives at court about an attack by the Gr...

choices: You set sail and there is battle!
1221311112111111.content:
Cersei pondered her decision a moment or two more and then shrugged her shoulders, "Go and and hinder the Ironborn as you may."

You instantly fall to your knees, "My thanks Your Grace, I will send your foes to the bottom of the sea."

The queen presented her hand. You looked at it with utter longing and then touched her hand with your own and brushed your lips across her fair skin. You longed to truly kiss this perfect hand but that would be uncouth. You controlled your foolish desire (for why would such a noble and fair creature deign to sleep with her bodyguard) and the moment passed. You remained on your knees as the queen swept past you.

You stayed there and actually touched your lips with your own hand, your lips, her hand. You rose to your feet unsteadily. That had been the greatest moment of your life. Her hand. Your lips. You would treasure it always. Now you had a duty to perform and a queen to impress. The Ironborn thought themselves masters of the sea but their arrogance would cost them. Setting a brisk pace you made your arrangements.

You knew who the best mercenaries were - you had hired them frequently, hell you had trained a good chunk of your own men. Two to one odds would be easy enough to win and you looked forward to winning several battles. You also hired two merchant vessels to trail you - after you captured stolen booty and other valuables you would fill those merchant vessels to the brim and send them back to Kings Landing.

One of your most trusted mercenary companions was also eager to join you in battle. His name was Ulric and he was a heavily bearded mountain of man.

"Finish playing guard duty and ready to get back in the thick of it eh?"

You chuckled good naturally, "An interlude my friend. I have found my calling - the service of the most exquisite jewel in the world."

He huffed, "Whatever ya say lad. She's been married already and bore children I'd be surprised if her tits didn't..."

Fury enveloped you and in an instant you had rammed your larger friend against the wall with your arm across his throat and your knife pressed against him ready to end him if he fought back. You stared into your friends shocked eyes and spoke softly, "Ulric, I will forgive this but once. No one will besmirch the queen. NO ONE." You released your friend who looked at you in a new light, "Aye well - your the boss and even if ye wasn't I have no desire to offend a friend."

Your sudden anger evaporated and you gave him a half smile. "Gather the rest of the crew, I intend to waste no time."
1221311112111111.title: She gives you leave to attack the Ironborn.

choices: Easy pickings but then a message from King's Landing... time to go back.
12213111121111111.content:
You set sail and soon the plan begins just as you envisioned. You fly merchant colors on your ship from one of the houses of Tyrosh, a tempting target for any pirate. Soon one of the black sailed corsairs spots you and their ship heads your way. You give your crew a wolfish smile, "Just as we planned boys - get ready."

You had 20 oarsmen, 10 sailors and 20 soldiers. 10 of those soldiers had crossbows you had purchased for them and they lay flat at the edge of the deck, when the Ironborn boarded they would stand up and kill the first wave instantly. You gave the command to start fleeing at half speed, you didn't want them to suspect a trap. Soon enough they got within bow range and the pirates fired a few badly aimed shots from their longbows. Wind and sea do not make a good combination for an archer, the bow strings almost always get wet from sea spray and both ships were being rocked by the waves even in clam waters.

After half an hour of chase their faster ship (now that you are going at half speed) catches up and rope with hooks attached slam into your ship pulling the hulls together side by side. As the ships clash together the men of Pyke jump over from their ship to yours. As this happened the ten men with crossbows stand up and fire. Nine pirates die with bolts in their chest, one was clipped in the shoulder. The second wave stumbled over their companions and you and Ulric were on them.

You wielded a long sword and shield and wore leather armor for this battle. You stabbed the first stumbling pirate in the guts before he could recover from the shock of seeing the first wave cut down. Shoving the dying man backward you wrench free your blade slash another pirates face open. The third manages to block your first strike but your shield slams into his face breaking his nose and stunning him and he is finished off quickly. Ulric was cackling like a demon, choosing a great axe for this fight he just let the heavy blade arc. One stupid pirate tried to block with his own shield, all that accomplished was a broken arm.

By this time your 10 men had re-loaded their crossbows and fired another salvo. Dozens of pirates were dead and the call for retreat was issued. Not a chance. You, Ulric and half a dozen of your fighters followed the scurrying pirates to their ship. Their captain bellowed out orders but it was futile. Some of the crew jumped over board fearing death from blades and bolts. The captain tried to put spine in his men and charged you.

He was marginally better then rest of his crew, which meant he stood no chance. You parried the first blow, trapped his blade away from his body as he tried again and then ripped it across his body, disemboweling him. After that the rest was an easy mop up. An easy victory with only one causality. One of the crew had been stabbed in the leg by the enemy but he would heal and that was the worst wound suffered. Ulric bellowed in triumph. He gave another shout of surprise when he discovered what was in storage. This ship hadn't been full of loot but it had some fantastic items. Red Arbor wine freshly taken from the Tyrells. Several bundles of silk and a smell chest of gold and jewels. It was clear the pirates had found rich targets recently.

You gave the order to divest the ship of its loot and then set fire to the Ironborn vessel. That night you met with one of the merchant vessels and handed over the bounty and told them to make for King's Landing and provide these as a gift to the Queen from her loyal knight.

Tomorrow was another day and as the concentration of corsairs grew larger the closer your ship got to High Garden it would become far more likely that you have to fight off more than one pirate crew at the same time.
12213111121111111.title: You set sail and there is battle!

choices: Infiltrate the Sept and free the Queen immediately!
Find out what is going on, champion her if necessary for the charges.
122131111211111112.content:
A month goes by and you've hurt the Iron Born quite badly. Over a dozen vessels have been destroyed and their loot taken by you to be returned to Kings Landing to bolster the royal treasury. All is well until you receive a shocking message. The High Septon has had the queen arrested for Adultery to the former king and for the murder of his predecessor. You crumple the parchment in rage. How could this have happened?

"We sail for the capital, NOW."

Your friend Ulric walks over, "What's the matter?"

The Queen has been imprisoned, I need to return and defend her. Then murder every damn priest who so much as looked at her funny."

Ulric grunted. He was loyal and based on your tone it sounded like a great number of heads would roll as soon as your returned. "Ah lad, you've gone and got involved with politics - it will lead you to a bad end." You narrow your eyes and he lifts his hands, "I'm just saying my piece, you know I'd follow you anywhere." You nod not wishing to talk about it further. You were already thinking about what you would do when you returned.

1221311112111111121.content:
Time was the essence you would not allow the Queen to be harmed. The High Septon had been allowed to reform the Faith Militant and her prison would be heavily guarded. There were a number of ways you could go about attempting to free. The two broadest possibilities were through brute force and the other through stealth.

Brute force was what your heart desired. Laying waste to those who would dare imprison the Goddess of love love beauty would bring you much satisfaction. However since you don't know how many foes you may be facing even for you that would be a risk. You had Ulric and his crew and could gather other mercenaries fairly quickly.

The second option was to pretend to be one of the devout and sneak in and free her. Doing this also entailed risk as you could not bring you allies with you.

What choice do you make?

You had just arrived back in King's Landing and you immediately made preparations. Ulric and a dozen of his best fighters would be spear heading the assault with you directly on the sept (church) that the queen was being held. Other mercenaries and the rest of Ulric's crew would be laying down a vicious barrage of arrows. While the Faith Militant had numbers they didn't have armor and bows would be much more lethal then in normal combat.

You wore the gleaming armor as a member of the Kingsguard and boldly approached the sept. In a loud commanding voice you shout, "Death to those who defy her majesty!" Your sword leaps into your hand and you cut down the first two staff wielding converts. Screams fill the area as the zealous warriors of the seven charge at you. The first dozen or so are cut down by arrows. Those that make it to you face no better. You are clad in steal and your blade is a whirlwind of death, they stand no chance against your skill and power.

You cut a swathe of death through the fools and enter into the sept itself. Here you find some better armed fores but they quickly fall before you.

"Find the queen, a rich reward for the one that finds her first!"

Panic and mayhem reign and you and your soldiers are brutal. Ulric isn't as skilled as you but against the trash before him he is nearly as deadly. It doesn't take long until one of his crew excitedly shouts, "I found her she's over here!"

You race forward cutting down the one fool who tried to bar your path. You break open her door and see the object of your undying affection clad in rough cloth fit for a peasant not for her silky skin.

You instantly fall down to one knee, "Forgive me my queen for not being here to protect you."

Cersei was surprised to see you. She smiled and your soul danced within you. "All is forgiven for freeing me. Is the city guard with you?"

You shake your head, "No your majesty I did not know their loyalties, the fact that no one has tried to free you yet concerned me. I chose to strike swiftly with fewer numbers. The enemy is poorly armed and no match for me."

Cersei's brilliant eyes were lost in thought, "Then quickly take me away from here and bring me to the palace."

You rose smoothly and led the Queen out of the sept.

122131111211111112111.content:
The sudden strike by you and your forces did not give the faith militant time to organize. The deadly arrow fire made your escape easy and the few dogs that stood against you were quickly cut down by your deadly blade.

Your march to the palace was uneventful. There at the entrance the palace guard look on with surprise.

"Who goes there? Ser you are back from fighting the Ironborn?"

You growl at them, "I am and I have discovered the rightful ruler of this realm was a captive until I freed her. Let us in now in the name of the Queen!"

The palace guards saw what looked like the Queen behind you and saw your blood spattered armor. Wisely they chose to let you and your companions in. The Queen wished to see her family first, little Tommen was glad to his mother. Her uncle Lord Kevan Lannister was shocked at the Queen's arrival. The Queen demanded the small council be formed and an explanation of what occurred. Why had no one comes to rescue her?

It turns out the small council had been a band of fools and cowards. The master of ships had fled and the rest had apparently feared that they would harm Cersei if they attacked. You suspected it was more falsehoods. The Queen accepted their stories for now. It was time to gather the city guard, what other loyal troops could be mustered and punish the High Septon for his actions.

Lord Kevan Lannister advised caution. "Your Grace this could inflame the realm against us. You provoke the common people against us."

The Queen glared at her uncle, "He dared lay hands on my person! I will have his head for this."

It would take a few days to gather the troops in the meantime the Queen went to go rest from her ordeal in her chambers. She beckoned to you, "I would have you personally guard me."

You lower your head, "Of course your Grace."

Cersei had invited you to personally guard her in her chambers. After her harrowing experience you could understand her concern. She had been betrayed most cruelly. Once in her chamber she took some wine and poured it out. She beckoned you forward, "Have some yourself."

"As my Queen commands."

Her delicate and regal looking fingers brush your armor.

"Doesn't it grow wearisome to wear your armor everywhere?"

The Queen looks at you with a look you aren't able to decipher.

You obey because you would do anything your Queen asks of you. The blond woman was perfection personified. You take off of your armor and underneath it you had on a doublet and leggings.

The question threw you for a loop but you recovered.

You slip to one knee. "May the seven strike me dead if I am false. You are a Queen among Queens. The most regal, graceful, and exquisite woman. Pray tell me why you doubt this?"

Cersei laughed, "I don't. But a lady, even a Queen desires to hear that. Tell me my good knight, would you see more of me?"

Your tongue dried up in your mouth. What was she proposing. You averted your gaze.

"My Queen... I do not understand. Of course I would deeply desire to gaze on your full beauty but I am simply unworthy of that blessing. I am a man of humble means. It is my greatest honor to serve you. I dare not ask or wish for more."

Cersei looked down at your still kneeling form. What does she do next?

1221322.content:
You creep through the halls of the castle. You have clothed yourself in the raiment of a servant. Your task is stealth not war, though should you find yourself in a fight you were confident in your ability to win. As you got closer to the royal chambers the number of guards increased. Through guile, stealth and pure deceit you crossed into the hall where the queen would be finishing supper.

Out stepped an angry tired looking Kevan Lannister. He was the queen's uncle and whatever their conversation had been about had upset him. The guards stood straighter as he walked by and as every eye turned toward him you moved quick as a cat past them. Now only two guards stand outside the queen's chambers. You cast a watchful eye down the hall and know you must be quick.

You approach them confidently bearing a piece of parchment.

The guards look at you and say, "State your business."

"I have a paper for the Queen..." you begin to say but as you move to hand it to the guard you stiffen your fingers and jam them into his throat. You were careful not to making it a killing blow but he could make no sound as his hands grabbed his throat trying to get air. Next you strike the temple of the 2nd guard with a palm strike, he goes down quickly. You had just taken both guards out with almost no sound. You prop them up carefully so they look like they are leaning against the wall. When the next guard comes by it will be obvious but not from a distance. You should have time to meet with the woman you would serve.

You open the door quietly and see the Queen sitting by the table holding a cup of wine.

Her figure is amazing. Her golden hair cascades down her slender shoulders. Her bright green eyes widen at your appearance. She breaths in and you see her wondrous bosom swell.

You kneel before her before she can cry out. "Your Majesty."

"Who are you, what are you doing in my chambers," she demands. Her voice is sharp and yet the sound is like that of sweet birds trilling happily in the morning to your ears.

"Your Majesty, though I am not worthy of the high honor I beg of you, give me leave to serve you. I am a man of many talents."

Does the queen hear you out or does she summon the guards?

"GUARDS," she screams.

You bite back a curse and plead with her, "Your Grace, I wish you no harm. Quite the opposite I hope to be of service to you."

She grabs a knife from the dinner table and backs away from you. You stay on your knee and raise your hands, "I swear it to you, please just allow me to serve."

Cersei glares at you, "You expect me to believe such an obvious ploy? Did my brother send you? Are you his assassin?"

You sigh, this wasn't going to be easy.

"Your Grace, if I wished you harm I would have already done so. I am no assassin."

Cersei glances at the door, "What have you done to my guards, they should of been here by now."

You smile at her, "Forgive me your Majesty but I didn't want to be interrupted. They are unconscious but have suffered no lasting harm, please I beg of you let me prove my self to you."

Just then you heard the pounding of boots at the door. You nervously look at the Queen, "Your Majesty..."

"Help, an assassin," she screams.

You grimace, what would it take to prove your loyalty?

"My lady, please I beg of you, I am on my knees before you if I wished you ill I would have done it."

Cersei hissed at you and said, "I don't know why you're here but when I have you put to the question I will."

The door was kicked opened and the first guard drew steel and charged you. With contemptuous ease you rise to your feet and side step the blow. As the man charges past you kick him hard and send him slamming into the rock wall of the chamber. The next guard comes in and slashes at you. You dodge the first, second and third blow by mere inches. You then draw your own dagger and use the hilt to smash in the guards nose and he goes down, his nose bloody mess.

"Your Majesty please, let me prove myself!"

Cersei glares daggers at you, "Throw down your arms and let my men capture you if you want me to trust you."

You sigh. You wanted to prove yourself but you had a very real fear that if you put down your weapons and let them bind you Cersei still wouldn't trust you. And while your skill at arms was unmatched, shackled and chained you too could be defeated. Still... this could be your only chance to win the Queen's trust.

Your nose was bloody, your ribs ached and you knew you were covered in bruises. No broken bones though. Sighing heavily you wondered if this was a rather poor decision.
