122331.content:
Daenerys is the last confirmed member of the House of Targaryen. She now lives in exile in Essos with her advisers and dragons. She is known as The Unburnt Queen of the Andals, the Rhoynar, and of the First Men, Queen of Meereen, Khaleesi of the Great Grass Sea, Breaker of Chains and Mother of Dragons. Daenerys is a young woman in her early teens. She is short of stature and very beautiful, with the silver-blonde hair and purple eyes for which House Targaryen has always been known. She is always seen wearing elegantly-made dresses, powder blue of and white of colour, which emphasize her serenity and purity, just like the intangible aspects of the sky. She is loved and praised by her followers, making her a perfect leader. Unlike her predecessors, Daenerys is polite and well-spoken, yet somewhat naive as of her young age and inexperience. Having lived with the amongst the Dothraki, she had built up confidence and grew to become a powerful ruler. Despite her reciprocal kindness and fair treatment of her servants, the continuous exposure to war and conflict has changed her. The Queen Of Meereen has become more cruel with her perceived enemies and sometimes, even her servants, the ones she considered unsatisfactory of course. Some rumors suggest that it is the ''Targaryen madness'', but who knows? Maybe the silver-blonde beauty is tired of endless political struggle which resulted in her kindness dissipating.

But enough about Daenerys, who are you?

1223311.content:
Before being stripped and given a battered piece of cloth to wear and locked up in one of Meereen's underground prisons, you used to be a very well known slave master with the name of Lizdahr. You used to own hundreds of slaves and didn't miss a single thing. You had food, wine and women. The only things every poor man of Meereen dreamed of. However, all of that was at risk with the arrival of the Khaleesi. She wanted to put an end to slavery which would in turn end your affairs. Slaves were the foundation of your living. Without them, you would clearly descend to being a no one. Of course you couldn't let that happen so you joined the Sons of the Harpy, an organization that is against the rise of Daenerys in Meereen. Everyone there considered Daenerys as a threat and wanted to terminate her reign. One of your mission consisted of you, infiltrating into the crop storage chamber and setting everything on fire, as a result creating a food shortage and hopefully create an economical crisis. This was supposed to make the Mother of Dragons vulnerable and look weak in front of the population, and in the end, for her to require help from the slave masters.

You had to be careful as you knew that your mask would give you away, so you didn't wear it for the majority of walking through the desert-like city of Meereen. You reached the place and examined the entrance, which was guarded by two heavily-armored fighters of the Unsullied. You knew you couldn't take them on so you had to think of something else. The building was a barn-like hut with no windows and a single wooden door. The crop-keeping architecture was also quite tall, standing at twenty-two feet. It was surrounded by several oriental boutiques, which sold a range of goods; varying from groceries, weapons and ceramics. And then you saw it. The ceramics stand was a shed-like building with wooden beams supporting the protruding roof of the entrance. On the roof, there was an assortment of vases and pots. You thought that knocking one beam over would definitely cause the small fragment of wooden roofing to collapse and the breaking of the ceramics to make enough noise to cause a distraction of the guards at the front so that you could enter and fulfill your duty.

The question was, how would you do that? Maybe throwing a rock hard would knock the beam down? You'd need a pretty big rock for that. Maybe going there and doing it yourself? That would make it too obvious. Just as you were thinking, a horse-driven ottoman-styled carriage had rode right into the beam, and a loud shattering sound was heard. The two guards hurried to the place of accident. You were astonished by your luck. Maybe it was fate you thought. But you didn't have time to think as the guards would surely return . You put your infamous Harpy mask on and rushed to the now unguarded entrance and opened it. You entered and looked around. The crops were stored in massive containers. There were over 50 of these containers, but to your luck, they were made out of wood. As the place didn't have any windows, there were torches suspended on the walls of the enclosure. You walked towards a wall and grabbed a torch with enthusiasm. You were going to put an obstacle in Daenerys' path and that made you happy. You didn't manage to turn around though, and someone tackled you to the ground, your torch dropping beside you, extinguishing.'Son of a bitch' spat the mysterious person in a Valeryian accent. And then he knocked you out by stomping on your head.

It turned out that there was another guard inside the place. Of course. How stupid were you. How could they actually leave an important source of food unguarded just because of a road accident. Why didn't you think about that? You guessed that the sense of bitterness smothered your logical thinking. When you woke up, your mask was not on anymore and your hands were tied behind your back. You were being carried by two guards, and they told you about the Unsullied that saved the day. The hero. They carried you to an unfamiliar place. It's entrance was dark and unwelcoming, with scratched, sandstone walls and a bunch of knights guarding it. You were handed to one of them and you learned that this was Meereen's prison, which you've surprisingly never heard about before. Slaves never disobeyed before the reign of Daenerys so there was no need for a prison, or so you thought, but apparently there was. You were then carried inside and down on a set of stairs which led to a dungeon full of prison cells. The warden stopped and got a set of keys out to unlock an iron door. You were then violently thrown in and the door was locked up behind you. After about a second, the door reopened and the guard entered your cell. He didn't say a word. He just grabbed your shoulder and turned you around. He then got a dagger out and cut your restraints. He then quietly walked out and locked the door.

You were so angry by your mistake that you smashed at the cold stone wall uncontrollably. You continued in a frenzy for about 10 minutes, until you run out of energy and breath, and so sat down on the uncomfortable ground. You felt your eyes close and slowly, you lay your head on the floor, feeling how you were falling asleep
1223311.title: Failure and Capture

123.content:
Laura Raith - Member of the White Court. She can kill with sex... literally. She is pale and beautiful. Ruthless and deadly. She keeps her word and avoids unnecessary loss of life; but not because she values it. But because while something is alive, she can make use of it and bend it to her iron will.

Maeve - The Winter Lady. She is young (for a Fae) and wields amazing power. But she's also petulant, cruel and sloppy. She loves to make bargains with hapless mortals.
123.title: Dresden Files

choices: A normal human but incredibly well connected and wealthy.
A scion (off spring of a powerful being).
1231.content:
Some more background on Laura Raith -

She currently rules the White Court through her father. In a weak moment Laura dominated her father and now he is nothing more than a puppet. Laura has no conscious however she is practical and rarely kills without a reason. She has worked with the primary character of the Dresden Files on a few occasions and has kept her promise. As a White Court vampire she is not like the "stereotypical vampire." She doesn't feed on blood, she feeds on sex and lust. When she feeds she can choose to kill or she can just "nibble." White Court vampires are stronger and faster than a mortal and can heal from a number of wounds but they are far from indestructible.

She has top notch security at her beck and call and the millions of dollars that the Raith family has accumulated over the centuries. An expert martial artist, a deadly marksmen and a genius level intellect round out the assets she has. Oh and of course... her drop dead gorgeous looks.

But enough about the woman you will be a slave to... what are you?
1231.title: Laura Raith

choices: Flash back to the Red Court Vampire fight
12311.content:
You are Jared and you are a powerful mage. You were 53 years old however you look like you were in your late 20s. Wizards don't age as regular folks do, the more powerful the wizard the less their age shows. In your case you were actually quite powerful. While you were officially part of the White Council you rarely attended any of the tedious politically oriented council meetings. Instead you focused on your art, you were a master of magic because that is what you chose to bend your considerable intellect towards.

You often pondered if you could match one of the Senior Council in terms of magical skill and power. Their powers were impressive and you did not know the full extent of them. However you have yet to meet your match in the battles you have fought. You snicker as you remember the half dozen Red Court vampires who thought they could defeat you, a lone wizard far from any Wardens or other member's of the council. You had disabused them of that notion quite effectively. You had also used some of the new tricks you had devised.

Most combat wizards like to manipulate external energies, they throw blasts of flame, lighting or force at their foes. Evocations were something you enjoyed using and were quite good with them. But that was so... limiting in certain situations. The greatest weakness wizards had was that their bodies were frail. Yes they could recover from wounds that would have crippled someone but that could take months or even years depending on the type of wound. Physical weakness such as a vampire moving twice as fast and then literally knocking your head off with sheer strength.

To that end you explored your own body. (LOL stop thinking nasty thoughts). You enchanted your very flesh with wards that would stop blows - by no means were you indestructible but you could take several dangerous hits that would kill a normal wizard before you suffered injury. Bullets too because the ward was based on speed and force of enemy strikes. Keeping your body safe was one thing but given a half dozen deadly blows would exhaust your flesh wards you also enchanted your clothing. Now there was a long arduous process. Week after week of layering enchantment before you were finished but now that you were finished it would stop nearly all piercing and cutting implements. While it would not stop the *force* of the blow it would keep you safe. An example is if a werewolf bit your arm it could not go through the cloth, however your bone may still be crushed from the supernatural power of its bite. Well that was true for most wizards, in your case it would activate a ward on your flesh itself that would stop it in its tracks.

The defense wasn't perfect - after all the wards on your flesh were finite, several bites would tear them down and leave just as vulnerable as the rest of the magical community.

Again you sought a better way to defend yourself. There was a branch of magic called Kinectomancy that was rarely used by the White Council. Essentially it involved speeding up your own body to make you more deadly. This was right up your alley so you perfected it quickly - again not a perfect defense because it did not permanently give you more speed only gave you short sharp bursts of speed. You also decided to learn a variety of martial arts disciplines to enhance your natural reflexes. So prepared the 6 Red Court vampires had stood little chance of defeating you.


**Authors note - I am reserving both chapters. Option 2 is describing the fight with the Red Court Vampires. It doesn't have much relevance to the plot other then a cool action sequence (when I finish it). It will also dead end as well. The other chapter will be the continuation of the plot.**
12311.title: A powerful wizard.

choices: Fly to Chicago and ask for an auidence.
Take down one of her enemies as proof of your abilties and loyalty.
123111.content:
Part of your research was learning about the various powers that could potentially threaten you. You researched the Sidhe both the Summer and Winter courts. They were quite dangerous and you resolved to try not to get into any encounters with them. You learned about the Fallen Angels trapped within coins - The Denarians. Based on your research you figured you could handle the lesser ones handily. Some of the more ancient hosts may be beyond your league - at least based on your current abilities.

Your researched the other courts as well. And that was when you saw the image of the presumed head of the White Court - Laura Raith. The White Council knew she was the power behind the White King. **Authors Note - taking liberty here but its possible Warden Dresden leaked the info in his report or Warden Luccio did - either way I'm going with it here). *** Like all White Court Vampires she was beautiful. But for you it was something more. The attraction was instant and ran deeper then just physical looks. As you gazed upon her perfection it was like your soul had found its calling. You yearned to be with this woman, no you yearned to serve this woman. This Goddess of perfection replaced your obsession with magic instantly.

-Here is a fan picture-

http://dresdenfilesrpg.angelfire.com/Lar...

She was greater than the sum of her parts. Yes her black as night dark slightly curly hair was the picture of perfection. Yes her creamy skin made silk seem rough, yes her legs seemed to travel endlessly displaying that luscious pale flesh that the White Court was known for. Yes it was all that but it was also more. Her grey eyes seem look out at you from her file. Like she could see within your soul. Shaking yourself you stepped away from your desk.

Was this a spell? A glamour? Was someone casting an enchantment on you? You rechecked your wards and then did a careful sweep with your third eye. Nothing was out of the ordinary except that your pulse pounded and you had also felt your manhood rise. Shaking yourself you paced the room. How could a picture have such an impact on you? You looked at it again and felt your legs quiver. You wanted to fall on your knees and proclaim your everlasting devotion to this Goddess. You stared at her and something in your mind clicked. This was why you existed. To serve her, to be with her, to help her achieve whatever goals and dreams she desired. You would make her priorities your own. You would love her.

You went back to the task of researching the White Court. You also booked a flight to America. If you were going to be with Laura Raith- the Queen of the White Court you needed to be where she was. And that was currently Chicago in the Raith estates that they held. Unlike other wizards you had made an accommodation with technology. By creating a custom ward you could actually seal your magical energies within a small bubble around you. It did make you vulnerable because your sense couldn't quest out however it did allow to use modern devices such as computers and allow you to fly in airplanes without risking the entire flight. As you did your research you started to plan how you should go about meeting the woman of your dreams...
123111.title: The story countinues

choices: She goes through with the test.  You vs. two White Court Vampires in a room.
She refuses but tells you about a job you can perform to prove your mettle.
1231111.content:
You arrived in Chicago and called the Raith estate stating that you were a Wizard of the White Council wishing to speak with Ms. Raith. You then took a cab to the estate. It was an isolated mansion with fantastic surroundings. The only difference was that unlike other wealthy mansions this had barbed wire, video surveillance and armed guards at the gate. They were expecting you so they waved you through.

You exited the cab and three men with guns approached. They all had an aura of alertness about them, their eyes constantly scanning the area for threats. You suspected they were former military. They searched you for weapons and you gave them your knife and blasting rod. "Don't lose those," you tell them as they escort you into the Raith residence. The entire place spoke of refined wealth and you were impressed by the combination of style and purpose.

The guards took you to one of the wings of the mansion and the scenery changed from wealthy residence to an office. There were probably a dozen cubicles and several offices and everyone seemed to be working efficiently. The security guards walked you to Laura's office. One opened the door and you walked on in. The room itself was spacious and very organized. Truth be told you couldn't remember much about the room because Laura Raith had rose to greet you as you entered.

Instantly your mouth dried up. Your pulse raced and you felt your loins stir. She was... perfect. She was wearing a white office blouse unbutton just enough so a hint of her generous cleavage was showing. Her black skirt was a couple of inches higher then normal office dress code and her heels were more appropriate for a runaway model. Silver glinted from around her wrist, at her ears and around one delicate ankle. She raised her hand, an obvious invitation to take it and kiss the tops of her knuckles.

You nearly shivered in ecstatic delight as you made contact with that soft creamy skin. You felt your lips tremble as you kissed the top of her hand.

"A gentleman in this day and age, a welcome change," her rich strong voice commented playfully.

You tried to speak but all you could do was make an odd sound in the back of your throat. Words failed you, you were standing in the presence of perfection.

"Please, have a seat Jared." Laura gestured to the chair across from her desk. Unsteadily you made it to the chair and sat down. You closed your eyes for a moment and used a mental relaxation technique to calm your jitters. Laura took her seat and crossed her legs. The desk hid the bottom portion of her legs but you could see the flesh of her thighs and your eyes were drawn to it like a moth to flame.

"What brings you to my humble home?"

You took a deep breath and finished your calming mantra.

"I... I seek employment with your house. I am a wizard and care little for the council but I do not wish to be isolated. Alone I am potentially vulnerable but with the backing of a major power - well I gain security and you gain the resources of a skilled wizard."

Laura smiled and your heart thudded. Her smile displayed the full lushness of her lips and you could see perfect white teeth behind those kissable lips.

"Interesting. Are you being hunted? Will you bring danger to me and mine?"

"No of course not," you quickly respond.

Laura simply looked at you and you lowered your eyes. Looking into her eyes could start a Soul Gaze. And you were just not worthy of seeing into those lovely gray eyes. Laura let the silence linger for a few moments and finally said, "And what makes you think I need the services of a Wizard?"

You had done your research. You knew the kinds of trouble that had occurred lately. "Your house had been assaulted twice in the last several years. First a dark wizard summoned ghouls that murdered several of your kin. According to the files at the White Council only the intervention of Warden Dresden prevented the estate from being overrun. Later your home was attacked by a Skinwalker who wounded several of your house and killed several guards. A wizard such as myself could aid you against magical threats as well as ward your home."

Laura pursed her lips, you stared at them hungrily as she drummed her fingers on her desk.

"Suppose I am interested. What do you desire to have as a payment?" You felt your skin flush. The word desire had such emphasis, her tone was so sensual you almost creamed your pants. All you could say in response was "uhhh..."

Laura laughed. "Oh you truly are easy. You come into my home and offer yourself like a lamb to the slaughter. You have had no dealings with my kind before have you? Honestly you are out of your league. I am tempted to consume you here and now for your foolishness." She let the threat hang in the air as your mouth gaped open. What? Why was she doing this?

"Oh don't look so frightened dear mage, I have no wish to offend the White Council you are quite safe. But someone so vulnerable is of little use to me. You have wasted my time, I suggest you leave."

Shame and sorrow filled your soul but also a spark of anger. Yes you were drooling idiot right now. Yes your first impression was one of a slack jawed incompetent. But that was just because of her. You were not a weakling and you are not a fool.

"Test me."

She paused, "What?"

"Test me. You doubt my abilities so test them."

Laura looked at me with scorn. "I don't have time for this."

"And I have no wish to harm you. There are two cousins of House Raith on the property. Put me in room with both of them for one hour. In that time I will be unharmed and they will be unconscious and not harmed permanently." Laura looked at you and sighed, "Hmm so persistent. Still there are risks, a helpless mage may spark their hunger even past their control - not everyone is as careful as I am." She thought for a moment and then made a decision.
1231111.title: Fly to Chicago and ask for an auidence.

choices: Magic Blazing - Charge in Rambo Style
12311112.content:
The ravishing woman of your dreams thought about your proposal for another few moments. Finally she said, "No but if you wish to prove yourself then another arrangement can be made."

Your mood brightened. Finally a chance to prove yourself to the woman of your dreams. She picked up a manilla folder and flipped through it.

"Yes, this will be quite the test. I want you to kill to someone for me."

Hmm this could be difficult. Using magic to kill a mortal outside of self defense was against the seven laws of wizardry. The White Council sent its Wardens after warlocks (the term for law breaking mages) and they could be quite dangerous. You honestly thought you could take any Warden alive but they didn't like to show up one at a time. Well maybe the Captain could prove difficult and the stories told about Warden Dresden...

"Fear not my dear - it will not be a mortal that you hunt."

She handed your the folder and you began to look through it. You were going to fight a scion of an elder dragon. The elder dragon had long since been defeated in the middle ages however its spawn still lived. This creature was half dragon and half mortal. His natural form was probably that of a scaly large humanoid but the creature also had its father's gift for magic. Which meant that is disguised itself as a human when it suited him.

The creature went by the name Avaradex. The scion was a mercenary - he "owned" a clan of ghouls who followed him. He sold their services to other denizens of the magical world as cheap but plentiful muscle. Has base of operations was in southern Mexico and his services had been in high demand after the fall of the Red Court created a power vacuum. After reviewing the material you nod to the personification of beauty. "It shall be done Ms. Wraith."

She moved closer and stroked your cheek gently, "I think you will fail. But if not... we can talk of payments upon your return."

A wave of pleasure flooded your mind. The White Court were succubi, they fed on pleasure, sexual pleasure. They could manipulate lust quite easy and you just had had an extremely heavy dose of it. You swayed on your feet, fighting to stay upright. You had embarrassed yourself with your earlier fawning and would not collapse twitching with pleasure like a helpless fool. Laura returned to her desk - a clear dismissal and you left her office and then her estate.

Hmm kill Avaradex a half dragon 300 year old sorcerer with an army of ghouls at his beck and call. You flashed the guard a wolfish grin as you got into the cab. You would be back - and soon. Laura doubted your abilities. You were not a Warden. No one knew of your slaughter of the Red Court Vampires who attacked you. You were a relatively unknown wizard who had yet to make his mark on the world. Avaradex had made his mark. Laura expected you to die in your attempt. This didn't bother you because you weren't going to die. You were going to succeed. Your only concern was how to actually do it.

Should you do it safely and effectively? Assassinate the creature with minimal risk? Or should you trumpet your power to the world, utterly destroy the clan of ghouls and then smash the scion to pieces in open combat. You were cocky but you weren't stupid and the second option bordered a bit on stupid. Then again you would risk anything to impress Laura Raith...
12311112.title: She refuses but tells you about a job you can p...

choices: Laura Raith is pleased and accepts you into her service.
Laura Raith is pleased but wants you to go through with another test.
123111121.content:
Avaradex was a mercenary that meant people had to hire him all the time. This was the foundation for your plan. You made some inquires and passed the message that you wanted to meet Avaradex and discuss a possible job. The meeting location was at an abandoned warehouse.

The ground was prepared with a massive amounts of explosions. You had carefully placed bubbles of magic around them disguising their scent and hiding them from view. They were out of direct line of sight however who knows what kind of vision a half dragon could have. You were also not going to meet with the creature in person, instead you were going to use astral projection to appear to be within the warehouse. Your real self would be nearby hidden under your best veil.

Avaradex arrived with a cadre of ghouls. You smile as he sniffs the air.

"You wished to meet in person for a lucrative job and then don't show up," he scowls at your projection.

You smile in response, "Lord Avaradex your strength is known throughout the world and I feared for my own safety if you disliked my terms."

He growled, "What are your terms. If you have wasted my time I will rend you into pieces."

Your projection smiles and then the warehouse explodes. The ghouls are instantly incinerated. Avaradex is not so easily defeated however. The flames tear through his clothing but do not harm his skin. The concussive force does do extensive damage to his body. His own magic rapidly tries to counter the damage but it is overwhelming.

He is thrown forcefully out of the warehouse and slams through a brill wall obliterating it. You pounce ready to unleash deadly magics on him. With fire not being as effective you lash out with a narrow blast of force. It is narrow to allow for a slicing effect. Avaradex is stunned by the explosion and attack but his innate magic conjures a shield of magic to blunt your attack.

Since he had not had time to fully gather his energy your attack bleeds through but instead of slicing him in two it just cuts into his scaly skin a few inches. He roars in pain and spits fire at you. Using Kinectomancy you dodge the flames and let loose with a blast of electrical energy. Avaradex is electrocuted, this was a lethal dosage. It would have killed any human half a dozen times over but for someone of his power it merely stunned him. That was fine however because that gave you all the time you needed to gather pure energy at the tip of your staff and then use Kinectomancy and magic to strengthen your arms. Your staff smashes into his torso like a spear. The destructive energy at the tip rips through scales like they were tissues.

Your staff spears through his heart and black blood vomits out of his mouth. The blood is acidic and you curse as your flesh wards dim down by a third. The acid must have been incredibly potent to have such an effect. Luckily for you the battle is over and Avaradex is no more. You carefully use your magic to slice of his head and seal it.

Now it was time to show your prize to the most beautiful woman in all the earth.
123111121.title: Kill Avaradex through careful assassination

choices: Pretend to haggle and ask for sanctuary and money.
Stand up and then kneel.  "I wish only to serve you my Goddess!"
1231111211.content:
You returned to the Raith estates and went through the same drill as you had the first time. You were escorted into Laura Raith's office. Again you were awe struck by her sheer beauty. The object of your desire had on a similar outfit, essentially rocking the 'sultry office girl' look. She presented her hand again to you and you took it in one trembling hand and kissed the tops of her perfect skin.

"Ms. Raith I have returned from your test." You said as smoothly as you were able to.

She smiled broadly. "Indeed you have. I must admit Jared you have surprised me. Lord Avaradex had been a thorn in my side for personal reasons for some time. I had hoped that you would harm his operation and increase his paranoia. I did not think you capable enough to slay him."

You took your seats and returned a shaky smile. "I am pleased to have pleased you Ms. Raith."

"Well you have caught my interest and you are quite skilled. I suppose we should talk terms. What is the price for your services?"

How do you respond?
1231111211.title: Laura Raith is pleased and accepts you into her...

choices: She smirks and turns away telling you to bring your belongings here.
12311112112.content:
You rose to your feet and then instantly felt to your knees in front of the delectable Laura Raith.

"Price for my service? Whatever you wish to give Ms. Raith. I long to worship you as the Goddess you are. Use me as you see fit to further you and house. I ask for nothing but the opportunity to be of service to you."

Laura smiled. "I see. Tell me Jared," her voice lingered on your name sweetly, "What would you desire most?"

You looked away from her face, down at her high heels. "I... Goddess there is much I desire but little I am worthy of."

"Oh? Go on my dear, tell me what you desire."

"I... I long to know you carnally."

She made a purring sound in her throat. Your desire was based on your longing, your own mental construct of her. But when she made that purring sound your body reacted fully. Your manhood rose to its full height, your lips parted in a gasp of pleasure, and your pulse skyrocketed. She was using her powers as a White Court vampire to draw this reaction.

"I know you desire me. I know how much you want me. How much your body longs for my touch." She spoke while slowly getting to her feet and standing directly in front of me. Her hand touched your jaw and firmly pulled it up so you were staring right up into her eyes who had gone a brilliant shade of white.

"But what if... what if I did not allow you to touch me. Would you still serve?"

Hoarsely you croak out "Yes G-Goddess."

Her smile is radiant, her aura magnificent, like a moth to a flame you cannot look away. You are absolute putty in her hands, what does she do?
12311112112.title: Stand up and then kneel.  "I wish only to s...

choices: Used for your abilities but not used sexually.
123111121122.content:
She smirks and you stare enchanted at the curl of her lips. She turns away and walks to the door. "Bring your belongs to my home. You now serve me as my pet mage, a court wizard if you will."

Your heart was thumping in your chest as your replied, "Yes Goddess."

You had done it. You were in the service of Laura Raith! What would your life be like from now on?
123111121122.title: She smirks and turns away telling you to bring ...

123112.content:
**Flash Back to the battle with 6 Red Court Vampires**

You were born in America however you currently lived in a small rural town in Greenland. You despised distractions when working and your neighbors were far from you so any magical malfunctions would not draw prying eyes. You also never made it a secret where you lived so eventually the Red Court decided to kill you, the foolishly isolated Wizard in the back end of nowhere.

It was late and you were returning from a nocturnal walk when you first realized you were being observed. Your otherworldly senses told you something was wrong. It was a cold day and you a heavy coat, muttering an incantation you summoned your staff. Your blasting rod was a small 18 inch piece of carved wood that rested easy on your belt - no need to summon it since it traveled with you wherever you go.

The vampires realizing that you knew they were there attacked. Two vampires rushed you. The idiots charged straight at you. With one smooth motion you lashed out with your blasting rod. Ogon you whispered and you summoned fire into your mind. Your magic lashed out and a horizontal, invisible beam of heat made the air blur. The vampires had supernatural reflexes however they didn't realize what spell had been cast before they felt the heat and at that point it was far too late. The narrow beam of fire cut them both into two. Their forms collapsing and burning with a stench that made you think of 3 day old burnt bacon grease.

Of course those two were the distraction. Two more Red Court Vampires from hiding had pulled out assault rifles and began firing at you. Even as you were burning the two vampires charging you has already called up a shield behind you. The bullets ricocheted off the shield impotently. A shield is nearly impossible to breach however each impact did cost you energy so it was a poor idea just to let it sit there while they unloaded on you.

Maintaining the shield you smashed your staff into the ground and muttered another spell. The ground beneath the two Red Court vampires exploded, they were both sent flying. However they were vampires and not yet out of the fight. Another invisible whip of fire burnt another vampire as he was still airborne. A fourth attack went after the last one within sight however he had landed and seeing what had happened to his comrades he had already rolled away.

A fifth vampire jumped down onto you from a nearby tree. You darted forward as you sensed his approach using your magic to give you a burst of speed that outmatched even a vampire. The vampire gave a startled snarl as he crashed into the ground and you cooked his ugly ass with another wave of fire. Four of the vampire were down. The gun toting vampire fired his gun at you again but had already darted behind the tree. The high caliber bullets sent bark flying everywhere. You decided it was time to test some of your abilities. Using your blasting rod you unleashed a blast of force onto the ground in a controlled manner, this rocketed you in the air time with your own jump.

This give you the momentum needed to hit a 15 foot high branch and then leap down onto the startled vampire. Using his snake like reflexes he recovered in less than a second and aimed his gun at you. You summoned your shield in front of you as the bullets whirled into it ricocheting everywhere, one actually hit the vampire in the foot. The magazine clicked empty as you landed. Activating another burst of speed you put back your blasting rod, drew a switchblade and slammed it into the vampires head. You were a blur, if the vampire had expected such an attack he did have the reflexes to avoid it. Your spells made you far faster then a human but only put you slightly above a Red Court for a moment or two. However you were a damned Wizard. They didn't rush at their enemies they fired attacks from long range. Completely off balance and surprised your blade smashed through his skull.

The spell energy stored in the knife did a lot of the work but the momentum from the attack didn't hurt either. His skull essentially exploded spilling disgusting blood everywhere. You brought up a shield around you just in case there was another Red Court Vampire hiding. No attack came but you had read the Warden briefings, kill teams always traveled in packs of six. You opened up your third sight and peered around the area. Ignoring the corpses you spotted one last Vampire watching from another tree but a quarter mile away with binoculars. Grinning with confidence you unleashed another burst of speed and started sprinting for him. And another.

You had unleashed several bits of magic, you were beginning to feel tired. Five blasts of fire. Multiple shields, multiple speed enhancements and even some earth magic. You were glad there was just one remaining. This one didn't have a gun but he wasn't unarmed. He had an actual sword. The practically of such a weapon seemed a bit absurd but it did give him more reach. Instead of running he waited for your approach.

"Well done human but you are lucky I had only these newborns here with me. A proper squad would of killed you."

His voice was cultured and carried a light Spanish accent. Ah an older specimen. You did a quick diagnostic to make sure the blade wasn't enchanted and decided to put your defensive wards to the test. You incant a band of force to surround your staff and give it a twirl. You were familiar with with the use of a staff through multiple martial arts disciplines, though the idea of fighting a vampire who was stronger and faster then you was rather idiotic. The vampire knew it too and snarled, "Pride goeth fool," and launch and vicious slash at your chest.

With the most arrogant grin you could conjure you let the blade strike you. It ripped through your coat and then struck the spell coated long sleeve shirt you work. That stopped the blades edge. Still you were being hit by force three times stronger then the best heavy league baseball hitter. That's when your flesh ward activated, completely absorbing all of the force behind the blow. The blow cost you about about 10% of wards in your flesh, better then you had thought. Of course momentum works both ways so the vampire nearly dropped the blade its sudden arrested motion. Calling upon your speed one last time you smashed your staff into the the vampires stomach. Huge quantities of blood sprayed out but the older vampire still had fight in him and impaled himself further onto your staff clawing out for your face. Not even using a word to channel the energies you simply let your staff radiate force in all directions. The staff that was still inside the vampire.

Yuck you recall thinking - while brutally effective there was no way you could avoid vampire carcass from splattering your clothes from head to toe. Afterward you burned the bodies and whistled as your returned to your home. You had not had a chance to test all of your combat abilities but so far you were at least the equal of the vast majority of the Wardens. 1251321121.content:
You join the Hogwarts School of Wizards and Witchcraft when you are 12. You come to the train station - confident in your abilities and your wand. The core of the wand is dragon heart string, power would radiate from you if you weren't currently hiding it. As you walk towards the Hogwarts Express you stop in mid stride. Before you is a vision of perfection - a vision of beauty that leaves you stunned.

Her body was nice and slim, her long blonde hair cascaded down her backside. You saw a sideways view and you saw her full lips speaking. Behind their glossy shine you saw her perfectly white teeth. Everything about her screamed poise, power and control. She turned slightly and you saw the most enchanting blue eyes. Like frozen sapphires they gleamed with intelligence. Someone jostles you from behind and your snapped out of your gaze of utter devotion. Who was this enchantress? Who was this paragon of beauty?

You silently cast a disillusionment charm to hide you from eyes. You creep closer desperate to hear part of the conversation.

"Yes, this year should be very interesting," the man next to her drawled. He was speaking to a boy around your age who was obviously his son. Their features and hair made them quite similar.

The boy responded, "With the brooms you are purchasing for the team I'll get to join the Quidditch team and finally show Potter what it means to go up against a Malfoy."

Ah an important piece of information. They were the Malfoy family. You didn't pay too much attention to politics but even you know the Malfoy family was quite rich and influential. They were also considered "dark" not that this distinction bothered you too much. After all if this goddess that descended from the realms of paradise had married into this family they must be doing something right.

Since the train was leaving soon they soon bid their son farewell. You longed to introduce yourself to Mrs. Malfoy but you held back. You needed to get on the train and furthermore why would she give you the time of day? You were 12 after all. And to top it off she was married. You didn't care what you had to do but one day you would be with Mrs. Malfoy in some capacity. Her husband (after you got rid of the lucky ponce who currently had her on his arm), her secret lover, her bodyguard, her servant or even her slave. One way of the other you vowed you would be at her side.

First things first - get onto the train. Maybe you could befriend their son? Learn more about the Goddess you desperately wished to serve. Or perhaps you should lay back a little and say nothing - make no friends or enemies just observe the lay of the land before proceeding with a course of action. You had heard that once you arrived that you will be "sorted" by a magical artifact that would put you in one of the four houses. Young Malfoy was probably a Slytherin but that wasn't a 100% guarantee.

***FROM WIKIPEDIA THE FOUR HOUSES***

Gryffindor values courage, bravery, nerve and chivalry. Its mascot is the lion, and its colours are scarlet and gold. The Gryffindor motto is "Their daring, nerve and chivalry set Gryffindors apart". The Head of this house is the Transfiguration teacher and Deputy Headmistress, Minerva McGonagall, and the house ghost is Sir Nicholas de Mimsy-Porpington, more commonly known as Nearly Headless Nick. According to Rowling, Gryffindor corresponds roughly to the element of fire. The founder of the house is Godric Gryffindor.

Hufflepuff values hard work, patience, justice, and loyalty. The house mascot is the badger, and canary yellow and black are its colours. The Hufflepuff motto is "Those patient Hufflepuffs are true and unafraid of toil". The Head of this house is the Herbology teacher Pomona Sprout, and the house ghost is The Fat Friar. According to Rowling, Hufflepuff corresponds roughly to the element of earth. The founder of this house is Helga Hufflepuff.

Ravenclaw values intelligence, creativity, learning, and wit.[HP5][HP7] The house mascot is an eagle and the house colours are blue and bronze (blue and grey in the films). The Ravenclaw motto is "Wit beyond measure is man's greatest treasure". The head of this house is the Charms professor, Filius Flitwick, and the house ghost is The Grey Lady. According to Rowling, Ravenclaw corresponds roughly to the element of air. The founder of this house is Rowena Ravenclaw.

Slytherin house values ambition, cunning, leadership, and resourcefulness; the Sorting Hat said in Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone that Slytherins will do anything to get their way. The house mascot of Slytherin is the serpent, and the house colours are green and silver. The Slytherin motto is "Slytherin will help you on your way to greatness". Salazar Slytherin founded the house. The Head of House is Severus Snape until near the end of the sixth book. Then, Horace Slughorn, the previous Head of House, comes out of retirement re-assuming authority. The ghost of Slytherin house is The Bloody Baron.[24] According to Rowling, Slytherin corresponds roughly to the element of water. The Slytherin dormitories and common room are reached through a bare stone wall in the dungeons. The Slytherin common room is a long, low, dungeon-style room, located under the Hogwarts Lake, furnished with green lamps and carved armchairs. The room is described in the second book as having a greenish glow.

***End Wikipedia Copy***

You thought about what house you would probably be sorted in. Ravenclaw made a lot of sense so you craved knowledge which brought power. Though the desiring of power was quite Slytherin so that house would also fit. Both houses prized wit and cunning which you had ample of. The other two houses were less likely but you suspected the sorting hat could put you in one of those houses as well.

Hufflepuff didn't quite fit though you were hard working. However your primary drive in life was now to serve Mrs. Malfoy. Your loyalty was beyond fanatical you would die for her if necessary. The last house was Gryffindor and you thought that was least likely. While you had courage and nerve in abundance you weren't headstrong. You were a planner. Also while you would be chivalrous with the wondrous Lady Malfoy you didn't have such thoughts about other women. Granted you could be polite if it gained you an advantage but that probably didn't get counted as true chivalry.

Your thoughts about the various houses were put on hold as you knew you had to make a decision soon about if you wanted to try to befriend the young Malfoy now or lie low. What do you do?

15533122211.content:
So who is Greta going after?

Is she going after Billy Peltzer?

One might think she's going to enslave him to avenge the other Gremlins, but to be honest, most gremlins would kill each other for a quick laugh.

So chances are she'd be going after him because of of the fact he's responsible for killing a lot of gremlins and she's the first female gremlin. Like a weird combination of 'him proving he's the strongest mate by killing a lot of gremlins' (even if that was not his intention and gremlins don't normally care about mating) and the fact that gremlins seem to hate Mogwai that refuse to change into gremlins.

So yes, she might decide to enslave Billy into becoming her lover/slave, simply because she might hate Gizmo that much.

Who knows Greta thinks of Kate Beringer? A rival to Billy's affections? A possible slave? Or are Greta and Kate somehow in cahoots in the desire to enslave Billy?

===

The scientist who made the various vials of serums. Let's trim it down to one person whose very smart. That way, Greta is drawn to him because of how great his intelligence is.

and how she either wants to enslave him or make herself (and any gremlins she spawns from water) into powerful gremlins that can take over the world.

Or maybe she just wants to turn all human women into gremlins like herself?

===

Remember the intermission of the second movie, where the fourth wall was broken, not only in the video, but in the theater version and even the novelization?

Perhaps Greta manages to escape the gremlins series and invades other worlds of fiction?

Due to her being a gremlin and their tendency for being able to hotwire any tech destruction, her invading a techno-based series would be devastating.

info.description:
This is the story concept:

You are a powerful person in whatever world you select. For example if you choose Wheel of Time you wield the one power and are an expert swordsman. If you choose Buffy the Vampire Slayer you would be a powerful magic user or an amazing fighter with lots of resources. You are a powerful force... who loves an evil woman. Due to your power you will allow this evil woman to triumph. She may reward you... or destroy you out of spite.

Lots of options so please join in!

NOTE: No rules other than don't spam a lot of short chapters. ANY fetish is also acceptable.
